Residential place for citizens. Occupants can have children. Can accommodate up to 4 people.

Can store items. Unlock in 'Technology - Logistics - Warehouse'.

Can grow crops for food and raw materials for production.
Can yield fruit. Can fell trees for Timber. Can only produce fruit after mature.
Can raise livestock here which can be slaughtered for Meat. Can get additional outputs depending on different types of livestock.
Can catch fish within the highlighted area. Requires an area including both land and water.

Can grow special crops and use Fertilizer to boost yield. Unlocked in 'Technology - Agriculture - Nursery'.

Can grow crops for food and raw materials for production. Higher yield than Field. Can be fertilized to boost yield. Unlocked in 'Technology - Agriculture - Farm'.
Can grow fruit trees. Can fell trees for Timber. Will yield fruit after mature. Higher yield. Can be fertilized to boost yield. Unlocked in 'Technology - Agriculture - Grove'.
Can produce fish. Fish output is affected by water area. Need to be built in an area containing both land and water.
Can plant trees and cut down them periodically. Unlocked in 'Technology - Agriculture - Forest Farm'.

Can produce fish. Stable output. Must be built on land. Unlocked in 'Technology - Agriculture - Fishpond'.

·Can grow crops for food. ·Can grow materials for production. ·Increase yield by 25%. ·Can be fertilized to boost yield. ·Unlocked in 'Technology - Agriculture - Plantation'.

Can produce Stone. Must be built on a hillside. Unremovable after built. Higher total output. Unlocked in 'Technology - Mining - Exploitation Technology 1'.

Can process Timber or Coal into a Refined Fuel. Unlocked in 'Technology - Mining - Refined Fuel'.

Can find Jade in Stones. Unlocked in 'Technology - Mining - Jade House'.

Residential place for citizens. Occupants can have children. Can accommodate up to 3 occupants. Can be built far away from Marketplace. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Tent'.

Can store all types of items. Can hold 2 caravans with high carrying weight. Need lots of people to form a caravan. High risk of meeting with a mishap. Cost some time to trade with various factions. Unlock in 'Technology - Trade - Water Trading Post'.
Place for students to receive education. Teachers produce Tech EXP for the town. Can hold up to 15 students.
Provides a resting place for the dead. Families do not lose happiness after a burial. Tombstones cannot be demolished, but will vanish after years.
Increases the happiness of residents in the service. Citizens with high happiness won't commit crimes. Structure with an AoE buff.
Patrons of the tavern have increased happiness. Can hold up to 50 people.
Can provide bathing service to citizens within the highlighted area. Increases citizens' health. Structure with an AoE buff. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Bathhouse'.

Can provide medical care for the citizens within the highlighted area. Able to treat diseases. Citizens covered by a health insurance have increased health. Structure with an AoE buff. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Hospital'.
Structure for town management. Can assign administrator. You can approve or deny the immigration of outsiders.
Can store all kinds of items. Can specify what items to sell. Receive silver coins for sold items. Unlocked in 'Technology - Trade - Grocery Store'.
Can educate adults. Teachers produce Tech EXP for the town. Can use Paper to increase teaching efficiency. Hold up to 35 students.

·Can store all kinds of items. ·Hold up to one caravan. ·Take time to trade with other Factions.

Can store all kinds of items. Can hold up to two caravans. Carry weight of caravan is higher. Higher frequency of transactions Unlocked in Technology - Trade - Large Trading Post

Citizens within the highlighted area have increased happiness. Structure with an AoE buff. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Theater'.

Make sure buildings are not damaged.

Residential place for citizens. Occupants can have children. Hold up to 5 occupants. Fuels last super long. Huge storage.
Consume no materials. Increase walking speed by 25%.
Consumes Stones. Increases walking speed by 50%.
Can cross the river. Wider and more durable. Unlocked in 'Technology - Construction - Bridge Building'.
Consume Bricks. Increase walking speed by 100%. Unlocked in 'Technology - Construction - Brick Road'.
Consume Cut Stones. Increase walking speed by 75%. Unlocked in 'Technology - Construction - Cut Stone'.
Consume Gold. Increase walking speed by 125%. Unlocked in 'Technology - Construction - Luxury Avenue'.

Residential place for citizens. Occupants cannot have children. Hold up to 24 occupants.

Residential place for citizens. Occupants can have children. Hold up to 5 occupants. Fuels last longer. With greater inventory. Built near Marketplace. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - House Upgrades'.

Residential place for citizens. Occupants can have children. Hold up to 45 occupants. Fuels last longer. With greater inventory. Built near Marketplace. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Luxury Apartment'.

Residential place for citizens. Occupants can have children. Hold up to 8 occupants. Fuels last longer. With greater inventory. Built near Marketplace. Unlocked in 'Technology - Livability - Luxury Apartment'.
An ordinary house for <color=#df840e>a family of 4</color>. Provides a place for citizens to rest, eat, drink and stay warm. Can only be built near Marketplaces.

Can accommodate <color=#df840e>two families, up to 8 people</color> with long residual fuel endurance and allows large stockpiles. Must be placed in the range of marketplaces. Can <color=#df840e> greatly relieve residents' stress rate</color>. Press F during placement to change its style.
The Stone Statues being carved by the islanders are their sole belief thus cannot be removed. They also build them in a certain order.
Stores <color=#df840e>Timber, Domestic Fuel, Stone, and Iron</color>. Workers will use the closest storage yard to deposit and collect goods.
Log Pile for transporting the carved Stone Statues. The Stone Statues can only be transported to the beach when there are enough logs for use.
<color=#df840e>Stores supplies</color>. Citizens without residence can collect goods they need at the warehouse.
A Stone Statue that is ready to be erected. It requires the efforts of all the islanders to make it stand upright.
The base of the Stone Statue on Easter Island.
Same function as a <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color> but with greater occupiable space, <color=#df840e>more workers</color> and <color=#df840e>more storage</color>.
Has the same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color> but <color=#df840e>more storage</color>.
Can <color=#df840e>store materials</color>. Smaller size comes with <color=#df840e>smaller storage capacity</color>.

Vendors will take all sorts of resources from Warehouses to Marketplace, which benefits citizens a lot in living and production. <color=#df840e>Houses can only be built within the Marketplace</color>.
Can <color=#df840e>store items</color>. Workers inside will transport stored items to <color=#df840e>Warehouses outside of the range</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Storage Yard</color>, but with <color=#df840e>greater storage capacity</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color>, but citizens can <color=#df840e>walk across the structure</color>. Unremovable.
Can <color=#df840e>store items</color>. <color=#df840e>Larger storage capacity</color> than Storage Yard.
Workers will take <color=#df840e>the selected materials</color> to nearby production buildings from storage structures. <color=#df840e>Functionally powerful</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color>, but with <color=#df840e>greatest storage capacity</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Warehouse</color>, but with <color=#df840e>greatest storage capacity</color>. Must be built on a hillside. Unremovable.
Same function and scope as <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color>. <color=#df840e>Smaller structure size</color> comes with less workers and less storage capacity.
Can transport selected <color=#df840e>raw materials</color> to supply station for nearby production buildings within the scope. Can improve the processing efficiency.

A house for a <color=#df840e>4-person family</color>.Provides insulation. Citizens can rest, eat, drink in it. Slightly relieve stress. Must be placed near Marketplaces. Press F during placement to change its style.
Can produce a <color=#df840e> Drinking Water</color>. Water produced can be used for <color=#df840e>fire extinguishing</color> .
Can <color=#df840e>grow crops</color> here. Farmers sow in spring and harvest in autumn.
Can <color=#df840e>plant fruit trees</color> here. Trees will yield fruit after several years of growth.
Can <color=#df840e>raise livestock</color>. Herdsman will slaughter the mature animals for food.
Can <color=#df840e>catch fish</color>. <color=#df840e>The larger the water area within range, the higher the yield</color>. Having multiple fishing docks in close proximity will decrease the yield.
Hunters will <color=#df840e>hunt</color> the nearest animals for <color=#df840e>Meat</color>, <color=#df840e>Fat</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color>.
Gatherers will gather <color=#df840e>Wild plants</color> spawn within the structure's range of effect. Wild plants are usually found <color=#df840e>near mature trees</color>.
Beehives are generally found <color=#df840e>near mature trees</color> within the structure range. Apiarists collect <color=#df840e>Honey</color> and <color=#df840e>Beeswax</color> from them.
Farmers will grow <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>special crops</color> in the field area.
Can produce <color=#df840e>Stone</color>. Limited total output. <color=#df840e>Unremovable</color> after built. Can be upgraded into Senior Quarry and Deep Quarry.
Salt-makers extract <color=#df840e>Salt</color> from Water, which is one of the materials of Salted Meat, Bacon, and Vegetable Can.
Reed farmers plant <color=#df840e>Reeds</color> inside, which is the raw materials of Paper and Ropes.
Dredgers harvest <color=#df840e>Sand</color> or <color=#df840e>Clay</color> from waterfront areas. which is the raw materials of Bricks, Glass, and Pottery.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Field</color>. Can use fertilizer to <color=#df840e>boost yield</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. Can use Fertilizer to <color=#df840e>boost yield</color>.

Can produce <color=#df840e>Fish</color>. <color=#df840e>The larger the water area, the higher the output</color>. Output will further increase if there is a Fishing Point, but the output will decrease when there is overlapping area of multiple fishing docks.
Can plant trees and produce a large amount of <color=#df840e>Timber</color>. Farmers will only cut down the mature trees.
Can plant trees and produce a large amount of <color=#df840e>Timber</color>. Farmers will only cut down the mature trees. Can use fertilizer to <color=#df840e>boost yield</color>.
An artificial Fishpond with a <color=#df840e>higher and more stable output</color>. Can be <color=#df840e>built on land</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Pasture</color>. Can use Fodder to <color=#df840e>accelerate animals' maturity and increase output</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Field</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
Same function as the <color=#df840e>Farm</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
Same function as the <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
Same function as the <color=#df840e>Eco-Pasture</color> but <color=#df840e>the size is fixed</color>.
Can raise <color=#df840e>Horses</color> and <color=#df840e>Donkeys</color> here. And <color=#df840e>the yield increases by 50%</color> if used to raise other animals.
Can grow crops with <color=#df840e>extra 25% yield</color>. Can be fertilized to reach higher output.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Mine</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can be upgraded into a Deep Mine.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Mine</color> but with <color=#df840e>unlimited reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Cannot work without <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color>

Same function as <color=#df840e>Mine</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can be <color=#df840e>built on flat area</color>. Can be upgraded to Open Deep Mine.
Can produce <color=#df840e>Blubber</color>, <color=#df840e>Seal Fur</color> and <color=#df840e>Lobsters</color> by using Fishing Net.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Quarry</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can be upgraded into Deep Quarry.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Quarry</color> but with <color=#df840e>unlimited reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Cannot work without <color=#df840e> iron tools</color>.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Quarry</color>. Must be <color=#df840e>built on a hillside</color>.

Same function as <color=#df840e>Quarry</color> but with <color=#df840e>greater reserves</color> and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Must be <color=#df840e>built on a hillside</color>. Can be upgraded to Deep Mountain Quarry.
Can produce <color=#df840e>Water</color>. Can <color=#df840e>put out fires</color> using the water here.
Can produce <color=#df840e>a large amount of Water</color>.

Can accommodate <color=#e5763f>up to 24 people</color>. Provides a place for citizens to rest, eat, drink and stay warm. Can only be built near Marketplace. However, overcrowded Interim Housings will cause the <color=#e5763f>loss of desire to procreate</color>. Suitable for accommodating immigrants.
Chopping House can process <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Dried Animal Dung</color> into <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> that can used to warm citizens in their houses.

Foresters will <color=#df840e>plant saplings</color> and periodically <color=#df840e>chop down mature trees</color> within structure range. <color=#df840e>More wood</color> can be gathered when the forester chop down trees.
Herbalists will <color=#df840e>search nearby land for Herbs</color> which generally <color=#df840e>grow near mature trees</color>.
Blacksmith in Smithy can process <color=#df840e>Stone, Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Iron</color> into <color=#df840e>Tools</color>. Can be upgraded into Advanced Smithy.

Can process <color=#df840e>Leather</color>, <color=#df840e>Wool</color>, <color=#df840e>Alpaca Wool</color>, <color=#df840e>Linen</color> or <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> into <color=#df840e>clothes</color>. Can be upgraded into Advanced Tailor and Clothing Factory.
Can produce <color=#df840e>Stone</color> but with limited total output. <color=#df840e>Unremovable</color> after being built.
Can <color=#df840e>produce Iron and Coal</color> with limited total output. <color=#df840e>Unremovable</color> after built. Can be upgraded to a Senior Mine and a Deep Mine.
Can process <color=#df840e>grain</color> or <color=#df840e>fruit</color> into <color=#df840e>alcohol</color> which can be used to increases citizens' happiness.
Can process <color=#df840e>Cotton</color> or <color=#df840e>Flax</color> into <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Linen</color>. Cloth is the raw material for advanced clothes.
Same function as the Textile Mill but with <color=#df840e>greater efficiency</color>.
<color=#df840e>More efficient</color> at making Domestic Fuel than the <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>. Also processes Timber into <color=#df840e>Planks</color>.
Same function as Sawmill but powered by water thus with <color=#df840e>greater efficiency</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Coal</color> into <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> for the use in Forge, Smelter, Kiln Factory and Pottery Workshop.
Can process <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> or <color=#df840e>Coal</color> into <color=#df840e>Charcoal</color> or <color=#df840e>Coke</color> for heating houses.
Can brew <color=#df840e>a greater variety of</color> alcohol than <color=#df840e>Distillery</color>.

Can grind <color=#df840e>Wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>Oats</color> into <color=#df840e>Flour</color> or <color=#df840e>Malt</color>, which can be used in Bread Shop and Winery. +50% production with grassland nearby.

Can grind <color=#df840e>Wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>Oats</color> into <color=#df840e>Flour</color> or <color=#df840e>Malt</color>, which can be used in Bread Shop and Winery. With buff of Grassland in the highlighted area.
Can process <color=#df840e>Flour</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> or <color=#df840e>Butter</color> or <color=#df840e>Jam</color> into <color=#df840e>Bread</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Malt, Beets, Sugar Cane, and Maple Sap</color> into <color=#df840e>Sugar</color> for the use in Jam Workshop.
Can process <color=#df840e>Fish</color> or <color=#df840e>Meat Chop</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> into <color=#df840e>Salted Meat</color> or <color=#df840e>Salted Fish</color>.

Can process <color=#df840e>Reeds</color> or <color=#df840e>Flax</color> into <color=#df840e>Ropes</color>. Also processes <color=#df840e>Ropes</color> into <color=#df840e>Fish Nets</color> after unlock technology.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Tailor</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of clothes</color> to produce and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Iron</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> into <color=#df840e>Steel</color> through exposure to high temperatures.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Smithy</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of tools</color> to produce and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Steel, Glass, and Bricks</color> into <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color>.
Can generate <color=#df840e>a large amount of Tech EXP</color> and use <color=#df840e>Paper</color> to increase output. Can be upgraded into Research Academy after unlocking corresponding technology.
Can process <color=#df840e>Dried Animal Dung</color> into <color=#df840e>Fertilizer</color> Fertile soil grants +50% production bonus.

Can process <color=#df840e> Medicinal Oil</color> and <color=#df840e>glass bottles</color> into <color=#df840e>Special Medicine</color> .Can also process <color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> and <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> into <color=#df840e>Bandage</color> .
Can process <color=#df840e>Coffee</color>, <color=#df840e>Cocoa</color> or <color=#df840e>Tea Leaf</color> into <color=#df840e>drinks</color> provide drinks grant happiness bonus.

Place that processes <color=#df840e>meat</color>, <color=#df840e>salt</color> and <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> into <color=#df840e>sausages, bacon</color> or <color=#df840e>salted meat</color>.

Can process <color=#df840e>vegetables</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> or <color=#df840e>fruits</color> and <color=#df840e>Sugar</color>and <color=#df840e>Meat Chop</color>,<color=#df840e>Fish</color> and <color=#df840e>Salt</color> into <color=#df840e>Vegetable Can</color> or <color=#df840e>Fruit Can</color> or <color=#df840e>Meat Can</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> or <color=#df840e>Wool</color> and <color=#df840e>Cloth</color> into <color=#df840e>Bedding Set</color>. Can be upgraded into Bedding Factory.
Can process <color=#df840e>Timber</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color> into <color=#df840e>Furniture</color>. Can be upgraded into Luxury Furniture Factory.
Can process <color=#df840e>Fat</color> into <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color>, and process <color=#df840e>Lamp Oil</color> and <color=#df840e>Glass Bottles</color> into <color=#df840e>Lanterns</color>.

Can process <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and <color=#df840e>catalysts</color> into <color=#df840e> pottery</color> or <color=#df840e>porcelain</color>, and <color=#df840e>silver ore</color> into <color=#df840e>Silver cutlery</color>
Same function as the <color=#df840e>Bread Shop</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of food</color> to make and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Meat</color> and <color=#df840e>other materials</color> into <color=#df840e>various cuisines</color>.
Silkworm farmers feed silkworm with <color=#df840e>Mulberry Leaf</color> for <color=#df840e>Silkworm Cocoons</color>, which is the raw materials for silk production at the Textile Mill.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Paper Mill</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Also can produce <color=#df840e>Ink</color> and <color=#df840e>Books</color>.

Same function as <color=#df840e>Bedding Shop</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Can also process <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> and <color=#df840e>Silk</color> into <color=#df840e>Luxury Bedding</color>.

Same function as <color=#df840e>Furniture Factory</color> but with <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>. Also can process <color=#df840e>Planks</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> into <color=#df840e>Luxury Furniture</color>.
Same function as the <color=#df840e>Forge</color>. Also processes <color=#df840e>Steel Tools, Ropes</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather</color> into <color=#df840e>Tool Kits</color>.
Can process <color=#df840e>Silver</color> into coins for use in town.
A structure upgraded from <color=#df840e>Research Institute</color> where can consume Books to improve research efficiency.
Can process <color=#df840e>Silver</color> or <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> or <color=#df840e>Jade</color> into Jewelry for trading.

Can brew <color=#df840e>Beer</color> from <color=#df840e>Wheat</color> or <color=#df840e>Oats</color> which can be used to increase citizens' happiness. Can be upgraded to Winery after unlocking the corresponding technology.
Can process <color=#df840e>Iron</color>, <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> and <color=#df840e>Jade</color> into Statues for trading.
Can pan <color=#df840e>Sand</color> for <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color> for the use in Carving Workshop and Jewelry Workshop.
Can find <color=#df840e>Jade</color> in <color=#df840e>Stone</color>, which can be used in the Carving Workshop and Jewelry Workshop.
Same function as <color=#df840e>Advanced Tailor</color> but with <color=#df840e>a greater variety of clothes</color> to produce and <color=#df840e>higher efficiency</color>.

Can process <color=#df840e>Fat</color>, <color=#df840e>Blubber</color> or <color=#df840e>Beeswax</color> into <color=#df840e>Soap</color>. Citizens use soap to clean themselves and <color=#df840e>increase health</color>.

Can process <color=#df840e>Sand</color> or <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> into <color=#df840e>Glass</color>, <color=#df840e>Glass Bottle</color> and <color=#df840e>Bricks</color> by melting raw materials at high temperatures.
Can produce all kinds of <color=#df840e>candies</color> which can <color=#df840e>increase happiness</color> after eating.

Makeshift resident for a <color=#df840e>3-person family</color> with light material consumption. Provides citizens with rest, food and drink. Can be heated . <color=#df840e>Can be placed outside the control zone of Marketplace</color> .

Traders will transport <color=#df840e>selected items</color> to the caravan in Trading Post. Caravan can be dispatched to <color=#df840e>trade with Factions</color> periodically. Water Trading Post, with larger inventory and high death risk, requires much more people to do trading.

Children between 8 to 9 will go to school for education and will graduate after <color=#df840e>finishing their class</color>. Students who live far away from school take longer to graduate. They are <color=#df840e>more efficient</color> in work after graduation.
A <color=#df840e>Cemetery</color> is used as a resting place for citizens that have passed away. If there is no tombstone for the dead, the family will grieve and lose happiness.
Cathedrals provides citizens with spiritual sustenance, thus grants <color=#df840e>increase happiness</color> bonus, upgradable from chapels.
Citizens can entertain themselves and get service from bartenders, thus can <color=#df840e>increase happiness</color>.
Citizens can keep their body clean by enjoying a body scrub at the bathhouse, thus increase their <color=#df840e>health</color>.
Upgraded from <color=#df840e>Clinic</color>, Hospital can <color=#df840e>increase more health</color>.
<color=#df840e>Central building</color> of the town where you can accept <color=#df840e>immigrants</color> and recruit an <color=#df840e>administrator</color>.
<color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town. <color=#df840e>Provides lighting</color> at night.
A mini-market where you can regularly <color=#df840e>sell goods</color> in exchange for <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>.
Uneducated adults can go to Adult School. <color=#df840e>Immigrants</color> will go to school before going to work. Their <color=#df840e>efficiency increases</color> after graduation.
<color=#df840e>Cure sicks</color>，and raises health of nearby citizens. Can be upgraded to <color=#df840e>hospital</color> with required techs unlocked.
Traders will transport <color=#df840e>selected items</color> to the caravan in Trading Post. Caravan can be dispatched to <color=#df840e>trade with Factions</color> periodically.
School-age children will live and study in the Boarding School and their <color=#df840e>efficiency increases</color> after graduation. Graduated children need to move into new houses.
Same function as the Small Trading Post with <color=#df840e>larger inventory and structure size</color>. More traders can work here and more caravan can also be formed here.

<color=#df840e>Merchant ships</color> will come to the Dock every a period of time with goods that can be purchased. The workers will transport the <color=#df840e>purchased or ordered items</color> to warehouses.
Citizens can now go to the Theater to watch plays, which <color=#df840e>increases their happiness</color>.
The Academy allows <color=#df840e>more students</color> to study.
Repair Shops can assign repairmen to ensure that town buildings <color=#df840e>will not be damaged</color>.
The Boiler Rooms consume <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> to provide <color=#df840e>heating</color> for area houses, decreasing Fuel consumption significantly.
Can assign builders in Builders Cabin, whose duty is to guarantee the construction of <color=#df840e>buildings</color> and <color=#df840e>roads</color>.
When <color=#df840e>criminals</color> appear in the town, sheriffs can quickly pin down suspects to avoid more casualties in the town.

When a <color=#df840e>disaster</color> occurs in the town, citizens can enter shelters to avoid casualties. However, food is not stored in shelters and need to be evacuated from shelters as soon as possible after the disaster.

A pleasant home for <color=#df840e>a family of 5</color>. Storage capacity is greater than <color=#df840e>a two-story house</color>, fuel lasts longer and help <color=#df840e>relieve more stress</color>, can only be built within the market places. Press F during preview to change its type.
Building bridges allows citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.
Building tunnels allows citizens to <color=#df840e>travel through mountains</color>. Each side of a Tunnel should have more than 2 grids on land.
Increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>25%</color>.
Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>Stone</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>50%</color>.

Wider bridges allow more citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>75%</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.
Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>bricks</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>100%</color>.
Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>Cut Stone</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>75%</color>.
Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>Gold Sand</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>125%</color>.
Roads constructed with <color=#df840e>jade</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>125%</color>.

Bridges constructed with <color=#df840e>jade</color>, allow more citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Greatly increases citizens' movement speed when on road by <color=#df840e>125%</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.

Bridges constructed with <color=#df840e>cut stone</color>, allow more citizens to <color=#df840e>cross the river</color>. Greatly increases the speed that citizens walk by <color=#df840e>75%</color>. Each side of a bridge should have more than 2 grids on land.
A temporary shelter for <color=#df840e>32 people</color>. Storage capacity is larger than <color=#df840e>an Interim Housing</color> and fuel lasts longer, can only be built within the market places.
Decorative trees that can be built in towns need decorative saplings to be made.
A <color=#df840e>decorative</color> flower-stand that can be placed in the town. Citizens can travel through it.

A small <color=#df840e>decorative</color> Stone Statue that can slightly reduce citizens' stress. <color=#df840e>Unlock after surviving in Easter Island mode on any difficulty</color>. Press F during placement to change its style.

Can accommodate <color=#df840e>15 families, up to 45 people</color> with larger inventory than <color=#df840e>Interim Housing</color>. Fuel last longer. Each family inside can <color=#df840e>have a child</color>. Built near <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color>.

A <color=#f8af23>merchant ship</color> has arrived at the port.
The delivery ship has arrived with your ordered goods.
The <color=#f8af23>administrator's</color> term of office has expired.
New animals acquired. Build a Pasture to raise them.
The merchant ship has arrived. Go and see what goods the merchant has brought.
The merchant ship has arrived with your order. Your items have been unloaded.
<color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens are freezing! Click the icon to check each of them.
A snowstorm is raging in your town.
A tornado is raging in your town.
New technology points aquired! Use them in Technology.
The autumn harvest has begun. Build storage structures near the fields for better efficiency.
There are <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens without a house! Click the icon to check each of them.
<color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens are starving! Click the icon to check each of them.
<color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens are sick! Click the icon to check each of them.
<color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens got injured during work. Click the icon to check each of them.
All Storage Yards are full! Need to build new Storage Yard.
An administrator's term is about to expire! Click the icon to switch to the Town Hall.
The sheriff found an murderer. You can choose whether to banish him from your town.
There are <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens without workplaces! Click the icon to check each of them.
There are <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens without clothes! Click the icon to check each of them. Clothes can be made in <color=#f8af23>Tailor</color>.
No repairmen. Please beware of building damage. You can build the <color=#e75818>Repair Shop</color> and assign repairmen there.
Fuel reserves are low. Citizens may get frostbite.
Herb reserves are low. Citizens' health may decrease.
Lacking laborers may impact the transport and production. Unemploy some workers to have more laborers.
Stone reserve is low. Construction may be affected. Stone can be gathered in the wild or mined from the Quarry.
Tech points have not been used for a long time. Please use them to unlock some tech in Technology.
There are <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens without tools! Click the icon to check each of them.
Timber supplies are low. Construction and Domestic Fuel production may be affected. Timber can be harvested in the Foresters Hut.
Immigrants are visiting your town. Check in Town Hall for more info!
There are <color=#f8af23>{0}</color> residents who have become adults and want their own houses.
New seeds acquired. Can grow the crop in the field now.
<color=#f8af23>{0}</color> citizens are thirsty! Click the icon to check each of them.
All Warehouses are full! Need <color=#f8af23>Storage Yard</color>, or production in structures will <color=#f8af23>stop</color>！
The citizen will be banished from the town, but the happiness of his/her family will be greatly reduced. Are you sure you want to exile this citizen?
Suffering from a disease that might spread to others.
Suffering from a Plague that might spread to others.
Suffering from Cholera that might spread to others.
Suffering from Measles that might spread to others.
Suffering from Tuberculosis that might spread to others.
Suffering from Pandemic that might spread to others.
No clothes, easier to be frozen to death.
This tutorial will guide you through the <color=#df840e>basic operations</color> in game.
Now try to cut down some trees to get some wood. <color=#df840e>Right click</color> can exit the selected command states.
Tap on the <color=#df840e>Speed</color> button once, and make the game to <color=#df840e>5x speed</color>.
After the structure is closed, production will stop and workers will leave. Now, please try to <color=#df840e>close the marketplace</color>.
Please click on the <color=#df840e>house</color> to open the building details, and then click the locate button in the upper right corner to <color=#df840e>switch</color> to other house.
Click a <color=#df840e>Storage Yard</color> to set its <color=#df840e>Storable Items</color>.
Select <color=#df840e>Bridge</color> in <color=#df840e>Roads</color> toolbar. Bridge has to be placed over water and 2 grids each side of it has to be placed on land.

Select the tunnel in the <color=#df840e>Road </color>, pay attention to the tunnel have to pass through the mountain, the length of both sides on the flat ground has two squares before you can place it, let's build your first tunnel.
Tap on the menu button to open <color=#df840e>City Details</color> panel.

·Tap the house icon at the bottom to find Houses. ·Press and hold the structure icon to learn more details. ·Tap the <color=#df840e>rotate</color> button to rotate the building when placing the structure.

·Tap the carrot icon at the bottom to find the Standard Field. ·<color=#df840e>Choose products</color> so the Field can start working. ·Sowing and harvesting a Field requires the right season and temperature.
You can open the menu by the Menu button at the <color=#df840e>upper right corner</color>.
·Tap the fir tree icon at the bottom to find the Foresters Hut. ·Foresters Hut works better <color=#df840e>in forests</color>.
·Tap the fir tree icon at the bottom to find the Gatherers Hut. ·More harvestable plants will grow around <color=#df840e>mature trees</color>.

·Tap the fir tree icon at the bottom to find the Hunters Hut. ·Hunters will hunt <color=#df840e>animals</color> on the map and <color=#df840e>have chances to get cubs</color>. ·Hunters' hunting range is all the areas they can reach.

·Tap the hammer icon at the bottom to find the Chopping House. ·Buildings with multiple recipes will only start working after <color=#df840e>choosing a product</color>. ·<color=#df840e>Sawmill</color> and <color=#df840e>Water Sawmill</color> can also help complete the task but you need to unlock them in Town Technology.

·Tap the hammer icon at the bottom to find Big Well. ·Water is a crucial survival resource. Wells, Big Wells and Reservoirs (unlocked in Town Technology) can produce large amounts of water. When <color=#df840e>there's a fire</color>, citizens will get water from the Well and Big Well to put it out.
·Tap the house icon at the bottom to find houses. ·Citizens who have houses to live in can quickly restore stamina. ·You can use Command to collect resources on the map.
·Tap the palace icon at the bottom to find the Repair Shop. ·Repairman can keep your buildings <color=#df840e>from being damaged</color>. ·Buildings need to be rebuilt if disasters destroy them.

·Tap a building to enter the building panel. ·You can disable the building by toggling the green button near the Standard Field. ·After the building is disabled, <color=#df840e>workers will leave</color> and <color=#df840e>production will stop</color>. ·Farmers will help laborers transport items when it's slack season. You can also disable Fields to have more laborers.

·Tap the palace icon at the bottom to find the Chapel. ·Chapel can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Happiness</color> within its range. ·Citizens who live within a Chapel's range <color=#df840e>will not commit crimes</color>.
·Tap the palace icon at the bottom to find the Clinic. ·Clinics can treat ill citizens. ·Clinics can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Health</color> within its range.
Slide the screen to move the camera.

·Tap the hammer icon at the bottom to find the Distillery. ·Alcohol can increase citizens' <color=#df840e>Happiness</color>. ·Buildings with multiple recipes will only start working after choosing a product.
Please click on people statistics and <color=#df840e>open the citizen statistics menu</color> to view.
Here you can see the upcoming events such as merchant ships, immigrants and disasters.

In <color=#df840e>Services</color> toolbar, select and build a <color=#df840e>Town Hall</color>. When there are multiple structures being built at the same time, you can click the more urgently needed structure and select <color=#df840e>Prioritize</color>.
There are some basic development routes, some answers to common questions in Help . Structure and item description can also be found there to help you plan better.

Now that you have understood the basic operations of the game, let's head to the <color=#df840e>advanced tutorial</color> where it shows you how to <color=#df840e>solve basic survival problems</color>.
Toggle the on/off switch again in building menu to <color=#df840e>enable the Marketplace</color>.

If you still don't know the basic operations, such as rotating the buildings during placement, gathering resouces on the map, viewing total output or consumption etc, you are suggesed to take the previous tutorial first.
Open Resources toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Big Well</color>.
You can also rotate the camera by holding <color=#df840e>the middle button on mouse</color> and dragging.
Open Services toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Repair Shop</color>.
Click on Builders Cabin and <color=#df840e>increase the number of builders to 4</color>.
Open Resources toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut</color>. Better to built it near forest, but not too far away from residential areas.
Please open Resources toolbar(shortcut: 3) to build <color=#df840e>a Hunters Hut</color>.
Open <color=#df840e>Food</color>toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Farmland</color>. After it is built, you need to select a targeted Crop.
Please open Food (shortcut: 2) and build a <color=#df840e>Orchard</color>. When the Orchard is built, you need to select crops.

Please open Resource toolbar(shortcut: 3) and build a <color=#df840e>Foresters Hut</color>. Foresters Hut will cut down full-grown trees so it is not recommended to be built near Gatherers Hut or Hunters Hut.
Open Processing in Build Menu and build a <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>. Processing type buildings will only begin production after <color=#df840e>choosing a product</color>.
Open Processing toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>.
Open Processing and build a <color=#df840e>Smithy</color> and select a product for making tools.
<color=#df840e>Tick</color> the resource to monitor its quantity more conveniently.
Open Services toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Church</color> at an appropriate location.
Build a <color=#df840e>Distillery</color> and select a suitable product.
Open Services toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Clinic</color>.
Now that you have understood how to ensure the citizen's survival, the <color=#df840e>advanced tutorial</color> will show you how to <color=#df840e>develop technology and trading</color>.
If you are still unclear about the basics or how to keep citizens alive, it is recommended that you go through the previous tutorials.
Open Food toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Fishing Dock</color>.
Let's build a <color=#df840e>Fishing Dock</color> once plank can be produced in Sawmill. Note that you will need to select a production product after the construction is completed.
Please unlock Research Institute in <color=#df840e>Technology - Education</color>. Then open Service toolbar to build 3 <color=#df840e>Research Institutes</color>.
Let's wait until <color=#df840e>a Tech Point</color> is generated. The technology icon at the top of the screen shows the progress of the current Tech EXP.
Click on the sidebar to view the <color=#df840e>detailed information on the citizens</color>.
Please open <color=#df840e>Technology - Mining</color> to unlock <color=#df840e>silver mining</color> technology.
Please build <color=#df840e>a mine</color> and <color=#df840e>choose silver ore</color> as the product. Note that the mine needs to be built on the mountain.
Unlock <color=#df840e>Grocery Store in Technology - Trade</color> and build one in your town.
Select <color=#df840e>items to sell</color> and wait for vendors to earn you <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>.
Open Storage toolbar and build a <color=#df840e>Dock</color>.
When a merchant ship docks, click the merchant ship or the Dock to conduct <color=#df840e>trading</color>.
If you encounter problems, you can view the help log or review the tutorial from the main menu.
In <color=#df840e>Tech - Livability</color>, unlock soap. Then open Services and build a <color=#df840e>soap factory</color>.
Some buildings have multiple styles, press the <color=#df840e>F</color> key to switch between various styles.
Your people have finally found a settlement and now start to build their own homes on this new land.
The speed button at <color=#df840e>upper left corner</color> can speed up the game.

You can view the building details by clicking it. Now please click on the <color=#df840e>Marketplace</color> and disable this building by the button at <color=#df840e>closed</color>the upper left corner.

When you have <color=#df840e>multiple buildings of the same kind</color>, you can click the circular <color=#df840e>positioning</color> button in the upper right corner of the building details to switch between them.
After tapping on a storage type building, you can manage what types of items can be stored in it by the <color=#df840e>Catagory</color> button.
<color=#df840e>The bridge</color> allows citizens to reach the other side of the river, increasing the scope of activities.
The <color=#df840e>tunnel</color> allows citizens to reach the other side of the mountain, greatly reducing the moving distance.
Knowing the details of the city is essential for management. Press <color=#df840e>(i)</color> to open the <color=#df840e>Town Details</color> window.
You can enter Settings anytime in game.
First, we will learn how to <color=#df840e>move the camera</color>.

In addition to city details, clicking on <color=#df840e>the number of people at the top of the screen</color> can also quickly view the citizen's occupation and population structure, including gender ratio, fertility rate, etc.
The Event Indicator at the upper right corner of the screen shows upcoming events <color=#df840e>in the next 20 months</color>.
In Town Hall, you can accept and turn immigrants into citizens. Once the population reaches <color=#df840e>a certain number</color>, you can also select administrators.
Open the <color=#df840e>Help</color> log at the upper right corner if you encounter any questions during the game。

If there are <color=#df840e>Laborers</color> (citizens that haven't assigned jobs) when <color=#df840e>enabling structures</color> or when <color=#df840e>new structures are completed</color>, they will automatically be placed in the structure to work.
This tutorial will guide you how to <color=#df840e>keep citizens alive</color>.
Citizens without house will recover stamina slower and work with low efficiency.
You can rotate the view by holding down the screen with two fingers.
Structures will break down easily without <color=#df840e>repairmen</color>.
When there are multiple structures under construction, building more <color=#df840e>Builders' Cabins</color> or assigning more builders can speed up the process.
In order to survive, <color=#df840e>food</color> is indispensable.
Hunters can get meat for <color=#df840e>food</color> through hunting, and also possibly capture an animal's <color=#df840e>cub</color>.
Fruit from the <color=#df840e>Orchard</color> can also be used as <color=#df840e>food</color>. But it <color=#df840e>takes years</color> for new fruit trees to mature.
Citizens may <color=#df840e>freeze to death</color> without enough <color=#df840e>fuel</color> to warm them up. Wood is an important raw material for making fuel.
<color=#df840e>Fuel</color> can keep houses <color=#df840e>warm</color>. Cold citizens need to be warmed in time to survive.
Citizens who have clothes in cold weather can work longer.
The availability of <color=#df840e>tools</color> has a great impact on <color=#df840e>work efficiency</color>.
Resources moniter can be viewed on the left.
A church ensures that the <color=#df840e>Happiness</color> of residents in the area is not too low, which <color=#df840e>prevents them from committing crimes</color>.
<color=#df840e>Wine</color> can also improve the <color=#df840e>happiness</color> of citizens and premium wine can improve even more.
<color=#df840e>Clinics</color> improve the <color=#df840e>Health</color> of residents in the area. Citizens who are sick need clinics to treat their illnesses.
This tutorial will guide you how to <color=#df840e>develop technology and trade</color>.
Many materials require <color=#df840e>technology</color> to be harvested or produced.
<color=#df840e>Planks</color> is necessary for building a Fishing Dock, but they cannot be obtained directly by gathering. You will need a <color=#df840e>Sawmill</color> to process Wood into Planks.
Open Processing and build a <color=#df840e>Sawmill</color>. Open the Sawmill's building menu and select recipe <color=#df840e>Building Material - Plank</color>.
When you think the generation speed of Tech EXP is slow, develop <color=#df840e>Education</color> first can greatly improve the output of Tech EXP.
With multiple Research Institutes or Academies, the output of <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color> will be much faster. You can further boost its output by using paper or books.
<color=#df840e>Information on the sidebar</color> displays the problems encountered by citizens.
<color=#df840e>Silver ore</color> is a valuable ore that requires a <color=#df840e>Tech to be unlocked</color> before it can be mined.
You can sell items for <color=#df840e>silver coins</color> at the Grocery Store. After unlocking the Mint Tech, you can also directly mint silver coin using silver ore.
You need to set the <color=#df840e>goods for sale</color> in the Grocery Store. The goods must be present in your inventory for it be selected.
Merchant ships will stop by the Dock after building <color=#df840e>it</color>. You can <color=#df840e>trade</color> for goods with the merchant ship using your own silver coins or goods.

Let's wait for a merchant ship to arrive so that we can try trading. Merchant ships do not carry silver coins. You can only trade for a merchant ship's goods <color=#df840e>using your own silver coins or products</color>.
You've completed the last tutorial. Now you can start building your town!
If the camera is too close, you can swipe the screen with two fingers to zoom in and out, giving you a wider view.
Tap the <color=#df840e>rotate</color> button to adjust the direction of house.
Build <color=#df840e>4 more houses</color> for homeless people.
<color=#df840e>Soap</color> can also improve citizens' health. Fat, the raw material for Soap, can be obtained by processing meat or by directly using Beeswax produced by an apiary.
You can change day and night in <color=#df840e>settings</color>.
Teachers can produce <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color> during work. When the town has enough experience, the town acquires a Tech Point, which can be used to unlock new technologies .
Note that the plants only grow <color=#df840e>around trees</color>. If there are no trees, there is nowhere to gather.

Herbs guarantee the health of your town. Maintaining a sufficient supply of Herbs can keep <color=#df840e>health</color> levels high. Advanced medicines can further increase health. Some of the medicines have additional benefits.
Foresters focus on maintaining an <color=#df840e>ecological balance</color> and do not produce a high output of Timber. You can unlock forest farms in Technology for a steady source of Timber.

To spend silver coins, you need to build a <color=#df840e>dock</color> or a <color=#df840e>ferry</color> for the merchant ships to visit. When no ships are arriving, you can place orders to deal with any shortage of resources.
A good supply of liquor is a significant factor in maintaining high levels of <color=#df840e>happiness</color>.
When the population grows to a certain level, a new administrator will be elected. Elected administrators have different skills.

Citizens affiliated with the church will not commit crimes due to their <color=#df840e>religious beliefs</color>. Note that a church can only serve <color=#df840e>a limited area</color>. It's still possible for other citizens to <color=#df840e>commit crimes</color>.
Clinics can treat diseases and plagues. There is no guarantee of stable <color=#df840e>health</color> until a clinic is built.

Once built, cemeteries provide citizens that have passed away with a <color=#df840e>resting place</color>. If there is no cemetery, the family of the dead will suffer from grief, and their happiness levels will decrease.
Also, the well is important for extinguishing <color=#df840e>fires</color>, so remember to place them in multiple different areas.
The time bar in the top right indicates when the merchant ship will be <color=#df840e>arriving</color>. The ship requires a port of call to dock if you wish to trade.

Interim Housings are intended to function as temporary housing when <color=#df840e>immigrants arrive</color> or <color=#df840e> disasters occur</color>. When there are better houses, citizens will move out of the Interim Housings. However, the <color=#df840e>Luxury Interim Housing</color> is excellent in every way and does not impair citizens' desire to have children.

The products of nearby structures can be placed directly in the marketplace. Vendors will automatically <color=#df840e>balance their supplies</color>, replenishing the insufficient and removing the excess.
A mine has <color=#df840e>limited reserves</color>. You can upgrade it to a mine with endless reserves in Town Technology.
An ordinary quarry has <color=#df840e>limited reserves</color>. You can upgrade it to an unlimited quarry in Town Technology.

Fertile adults will have children when their houses are not full. When the children grow up, they will want to <color=#df840e>move out</color>. New houses can be used by a single citizen, a couple, or a whole family.
You can sell goods at the grocery store to get <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>.

The fields will have a <color=#df840e>slack season</color> when the farmers do not work, though they will help the laborers transport items and follow basic directions. The period from March to September is the <color=#df840e>busy season</color> when the farmers work hard. Note that each crop has its own <color=#df840e>characteristics</color>. Some have an early harvest, and some have a high yield. <color=#df840e>New crop seeds</color> are mainly sourced through the Gatherers Hut and trade.
Stuctures such as <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut, Hunters Hut and Fishing Dock</color> can obtain food monthly. While structures like <color=#df840e>Field, Orchard</color> will produce food yearly.
<color=#df840e>Big Well</color> is in <color=#df840e>Resources</color> toolbar . <color=#df840e>Reservoir</color> is here too, but it need Technology - Livability - Clean Water to unlock.
Tools can be produced in <color=#df840e>Smithy</color> which is in <color=#df840e>Processing toolbar (4)</color>.
<color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> can be produced in <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color>, which is in Processing (4).
Items can be stored in <color=#df840e>Storage Yard</color> which is in <color=#df840e>Storage toolbar (5)</color>.

It takes many years for fruit trees to <color=#df840e>grow</color>. When the trees have matured, fruits will ripen when the temperature is right and the farmers will harvest the Orchard. In addition, when reserves are low, <color=#df840e>felling</color> trees in the Orchard is a quick way to get Timber.
If you cannot find the right fishing waters upgrading your techniques is the best choice. If there are no suitable fishing areas you can prioritize developing other industries.

You can <color=#df840e>build a bridge</color> to increase the yield of hunting. It is also possible for the hunters to capture <color=#df840e>animal cubs</color>, which can be raised in the pasture as a steady source of protein.

Houses with sufficient fuel will quickly <color=#df840e>recover</color> citizen's warmth, allowing them to return to work again. If citizens are cold and their home is too far away, they will go to <color=#df840e>nearby</color> structures for warmth. If a citizen's level of warmth is too low and they have no access to heat, they will <color=#df840e>lose HP</color> until they freeze to death.
The Smithy has <color=#df840e>Activating upgrades</color> can lead to the production of advanced tools. The work efficiency of citizens who work without tools is significantly reduced.

You can set <color=#df840e>product limits</color> for production structures. The number of products produced by the Tailor is related to the population, so you should adjust the limit in response to population changes.
It's getting dark and there is no light at night. You can build some <color=#df840e>illuminative buildings</color> to light up the town in Decoration .
You are constructing a school. Schools require teachers. The town's first generation of adults are all educated.

You are constructing a Gatherers Hut, which is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color>. Gatherers can gather <color=#df840e>food</color>, <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> and <color=#df840e>agave</color> in nearby area. It is also possible to obtain crop seeds that can be grown in the field.
You are constructing a herbalist's cabin, which is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color>. The yields of overlapping area structures will be lower.

You are constructing a Foresters Hut which is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color>. The Foresters Hut is a facility that produces <color=#df840e>Timber</color>. Foresters will cut down mature trees and plant saplings.

You are constructing a grocery store. It will automatically sell designated goods in exchange for <color=#df840e>silver coins</color>. Coins are common currency and can be used, without limit, for trading with the merchant ship.
You are constructing a distillery, which produces <color=#df840e>spirits</color>. The raw materials can be acquired from Gatherers Huts and wells.
You are constructing a Town Hall, which is where you will assign <color=#df840e>administrator</color> to govern the town. You can also <color=#df840e>accept immigrants</color> at the Town Hall.
You are constructing a church. Once a cleric has been assigned, citizens will start attending.
You are constructing a clinic. Once doctors are assigned, the citizens will have <color=#df840e>health care</color>. The clinic can only serve a limited area.
You are constructing a cemetery, which is the right thing to do. The max number of <color=#df840e>tombstones</color> is related to the size of the cemetery.

You are constructing a well. The well provides <color=#df840e>water</color> , used for drinking and as a raw material in various products. Citizen may be <color=#df840e>thirsty</color> if lacking water.
You are constructing a Dock. Dock are both <color=#df840e>ports of call</color> for ships.

You are constructing a Interim Housing. Citizens who live in houses will not relocate to a Interim Housing. Interim Housings are crowded and small, so occupants will <color=#df840e>lose the desire to procreate</color>.
You are constructing an adult school, which is exclusively for uneducated <color=#df840e>adults</color>.
You are constructing a boarding school, which houses <color=#df840e>school-age children</color> until they graduate.
You are constructing a marketplace. Assigned vendors will transport items from nearby <color=#df840e>warehouses</color> and <color=#df840e>storage yards</color> for citizens to use.
You are constructing a mine. A mine can produce coal or Iron.
You are constructing a sawmill, which processes Timber into <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color> with great efficiency. It can also produce <color=#df840e>planks</color> as construction materials.

You are constructing a house. Add <color=#df840e>builders</color> at <color=#df840e>builders cabin</color> to complete the construction. <color=#df840e>Homeless</color> citizens will move into new houses as a family.
You are constructing a traded goods facility, which processes raw materials into exquisite <color=#df840e>tradable goods</color>. These items are exclusively for sale and demand higher prices.
You have placed a field. You need to <color=#df840e>select a crop</color> and assign farmers to start sowing seeds.
Some citizens are <color=#df840e>hungry</color>. Select Gather Plants in Command toolbar to assign laborers to collect wild vegetables. People without work currently will go gathering too.
Some citizens are <color=#df840e>thirsty</color>. Well or Reservoir needed to solve this problem.
Some citizens have <color=#df840e>no tools</color>. Work efficiency greatly decreased.
Some citizens are <color=#df840e>freezing</color>. Citizens' warmth will keep decreasing in cold weather and vitality will also decrease until this citizen die if warmth is 0.
Warehouses or Storage Yards are full. Citizens have nowhere to store suppies.
You are constructing a fishing dock. It is an <color=#df840e>area structure</color> and the yield is related to the area of water covered by the structure.
You are constructing a Hunters Hut, whose hunting scope covers the <color=#df840e>entire map</color>. Hunters go hunting once a month. Note that the hunters cannot cross the river without bridges.
You are constructing a Chopping House, which is the main facility for producing <color=#df840e>Domestic Fuel</color>.
You are constructing a Smithy. Iron tools are more durable than stone tools, but stone tools are easier to make.
You are constructing a Tailor. The primary materials for Tailors come from the <color=#df840e>Hunters Hut</color>, while advanced materials come from pastures and the textile industry.
Tornado: Destroys all the buildings and trees in its path and carries away the people and animals.
Snowstorm: Temperature drops to extremely low levels. Requires warm clothes to work outside for long periods of time.
Fire: Random buildings will catch fire, which will spread to surrounding ones.
Plague: The disease is spread by contact.
Plague: The disease is spread by contact.
The yield from fields increases by 30% in harvest years.
When drought comes, fish disappear and yields from farmlands, Orchards and water structures decrease.
Acid rain is coming. Citizens who are exposed to it will lose 10% health.
Extreme cold is coming and a large number of wild plants and animals freeze to death.
The apocalypse has come. You can build a Church to improve the accuracy of prophecies.
The clouds have been a strange shape lately...

Thank you to the heroes who took part in our first test and gave us so much valuable advice. With your help, our game has been greatly improved! Here is a list of those incredible heroes:

The difficulty determines the <color=#df840e>available citizens</color> and <color=#df840e>resources on map</color> at the start of the game. Temperature and food production from structures will also drop on higher difficulties.
Disasters may lead to devastating results, but much of their destruction can be avoided with proper planning.
Mountains are rich in mineral resources, but may create problems for town planning.
Lakes are bodies of water surrounded by land. Suitable for water-related development.
Story Mode: You can experience the rise and fall of the settlement on a preset map by completing tasks when enabled. You can build freely on the map if you disable it.
Sandbox mode is for players who are already familiar with this game.
Special Structures: Rubik's Cube and Goof-off Hero will now appear in Blueprint toolbar when enabled.
Ore is necessary for several industries. They are non-renewable resources.
Each map size offers a different experience. If you are new to the game we advise that you use the recommended map size.
Map seeds create random differences in the map's mountains and rivers.
Vegetation provides primary resources like wood and food. Plants are renewable. Maps with a high vegetation density are more rich in resources.
River branches increase the water area. Works better with wide rivers.
Wider rivers mean larger water areas but smaller land areas.
The climate has an impact on both the citizens and the crops. Cold weather makes the game more difficult.

Survivors finally found a suitable settlement location through ups and downs. They followed the trade caravan to this land of no man and began a new life. A merchant followed the survivors here and became an important bridge for future trade. After setting up camps, the adventures of the survivors are just beginning.

Obtained by <color=#df840e>cutting down trees in the wild</color> or produced at the <color=#df840e>Foresters Hut</color>. Can be made into Domestic Fuel at the Chopping House. One of the most important construction materials.
Made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> in the <color=#df840e>Sawmill</color> or <color=#df840e>Water Sawmill</color>. Can be used for structure upgrades.
Made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> at the <color=#df840e>Carving Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>wild deer</color> in the <color=#df840e>Hunters Hut</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>sheep</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher, or some fancy food at Gourmet Shop. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>cows</color> or <color=#df840e>cattle</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>chickens</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>turkeys</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher or Fancy Food at the gourmet shop. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>geese</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>alpaca</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>buffalo</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher, or some fancy food at the gourmet shop. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.
Fuel made from <color=#df840e>Timber</color> or <color=#df840e>Coal</color> at <color=#df840e>Fuel Factory</color>. Can be used in Smelters and Pottery Workshops.

Food produced by <color=#df840e>cows</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Butter at Butter Workshop. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food obtained by slaughtering <color=#df840e>ducks</color> in <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color>. Can be processed into Meat Chop at Butcher. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Food processed from <color=#df840e>various meats</color> at <color=#df840e>Butcher</color>. Can be used to make cured meat at Curing Workshop. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Made by firing <color=#df840e>Clay</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Kiln Factory</color>. Widely used building materials. Can be used to make <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color>.

Made by smelting <color=#df840e>Iron Ore</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Smelter</color>. Can be used to make <color=#df840e>Building Kits</color> at Forge or <color=#df840e>Steel tools</color> at Advanced Smithy.

<color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color> made with <color=#df840e>Clay</color>, <color=#df840e>Sand</color> and a <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pottery Workshop</color>.

Advanced building material for structure upgrades made with <color=#df840e>silver ore</color> and a <color=#df840e>Refined Fuel</color> at the <color=#df840e>Pottery Workshop</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

Advanced material for structure upgrade, made from <color=#df840e>silk</color> and <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Feathers</color> at the <color=#df840e>Bedding Factory</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

Advanced building materials for structure upgrades made from <color=#df840e>Planks</color> and <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> or <color=#df840e>Seal Fur</color> at the <color=#df840e>Luxury Furniture Factory</color>. <color=#df840e>Tradable goods</color>.

Can be used to upgrade the <color=#df840e>Churches</color> and increase its service scope. Can obtain through trade, and also can be produced by <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color> after unlocking related Technology.

Can upgrade <color=#df840e>Field</color>, <color=#df840e>Orchard</color> and<color=#df840e>Forest Farm</color> to increase output. Can obtain through trade, and also can be produced by <color=#df840e>Knitting Workshop</color> after unlocking related Technology.

Remodel materials for <color=#df840e>Luxury House</color>, <color=#df840e>Luxury Apartment</color>, <color=#df840e>Garden Villa</color> or <color=#df840e>Great Castle</color>. Can increase the occupants' health. Obtain through trade only.
Can upgrade some buildings to increase their work efficiency. Can obtain through trade, and also can be produced by <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color> after unlocking related Technology.
A cute cat can release citizens' stress. Can be used to remodel <color=#df840e>various houses</color>, obtain through trade only.

A delicacy that is made by using <color=#df840e>Lobster</color> and <color=#df840e>Butter</color> at the <color=#df840e>Barbecue House</color>. Provide better fillingness and slight stress relief.

Fancy food made from <color=#df840e>Baked lobster</color> or <color=#df840e>Rack of Lamb</color> and <color=#df840e>Veggie salad</color> at the <color=#df840e>Gourmet Shop</color>. Filling food, have better fillingness and can <color=#df840e>ease citizens' stress</color> for a period of time.

Material collected by the <color=#df840e>waterside</color> or harvested from <color=#df840e>Reed Field</color>. Can be made into ropes at the Knitting Workshop or paper at the Paper Mill.

Grown in the <color=#df840e>field</color> or produced at the <color=#df840e>Gatherers Hut</color>. Used at the <color=#df840e>brewery</color>. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>gathering</color>.

Raw materials obtain from <color=#df840e>Pasture</color> or <color=#df840e>Corral</color> by slaughtering <color=#df840e>large animals</color>. Can be made into Soap at the <color=#df840e>Soap Workshop</color> and can be made into Lamp Oil at the <color=#df840e>Lighting Factory</color>.
Collected from the <color=#df840e>Fishing Port</color>. Can be made into lamp oil at the <color=#df840e>lighting factory</color> and can be made into soap at the <color=#df840e>soap workshop</color>
Collected from the <color=#df840e>sandpit</color>. Can be made into glass or Glass Bottles at the <color=#df840e>kiln factory</color> or panned for gold sand.

Grown in the <color=#df840e>field</color>. <color=#df840e>Inedible</color>. Used as a raw material for the sugar refinery. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.
Grown in the <color=#df840e>field</color>. <color=#df840e>Inedible</color>. Used as a raw material for the sugar refinery. The seeds can be obtained through <color=#df840e>trade</color>.

Made from <color=#df840e>paper</color> and <color=#df840e>ink</color> at the <color=#df840e>printing workshop</color>. Significantly improves the efficiency of technology research.

Made from <color=#df840e>stone</color> at the <color=#df840e>masonry workshop</color>. Can be used to construct or pave roads.

Processed from <color=#df840e>fish</color> and <color=#df840e>salt</color> at the <color=#df840e>curing workshop</color>. More filling.
Beans grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health. Higher yield than vegetables.
Beans grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health. High yield.

Cereals grown in the <color=#df840e>fields</color>. Directly edible. It's a rough food, long-time consumption is harmful to health.

Clothes made from <color=#df840e>Linen</color>,<color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color>,<color=#df840e>alpaca Wool</color> or<color=#df840e>Leather</color>. Keeps citizens warm.

Made from <color=#df840e>linen</color>,<color=#df840e>Cotton Cloth</color> or <color=#df840e>Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Feathers</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>alpaca Wool</color>. Warmer than rough clothes.

Made from <color=#df840e>silk</color>,<color=#df840e>seal fur</color> or <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Feathers</color>,<color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>alpaca Wool</color>. Warmer than a down jacket and makes citizens happier.

Craftable at <color=#df840e> Leatherware Hut </color> using <color=#df840e> Leather </color>. Increases citizens' movement speed, but will gradually wear out and needed to be replaced regularly. Reduce the chance of citizens suffering from ankle sprains and fractures.

Craftable at the <color=#df840e> Leatherware Hut </color> using <color=#df840e> Refined Leather </color> or <color=#df840e>Seal Fur </color>. Made from <color=#df840e>Plank</color> and <color=#df840e>Steel</color> in <color=#df840e>the Smithy</color> to add carry weight to the citizen but will gradually wear out and need to be replaced regularly.
