This game is a <color=#df840e>simulation building survival game</color>, you not only need to <color=#df840e>develop your town</color>, but also need to <color=#df840e>maintain the survival of the citizens</color>. If the basic survival needs are not met, the citizens will <color=#df840e>die</color>, and maintaining survival in high difficulty will be a major problem in the early stage. Even after the development and expansion of the town, it is easy to face severe survival problems due to disasters or population growth. We believe that after dying and retrying many times, you will be able to find a way to lead the survivors to survive and develop. If you feel difficult, you can choose to start a new game and reduce the difficulty of the game.
Before officially starting the game, you need to know how to view the data of each area and towns on the map.
Open the mini map in the menu to view the basic information of the map. You can also see the position of random seeds in the map.
Open City Details in the menu, here you can view the number of all <color=#df840e>professions</color> and <color=#df840e>buildings</color>. You can click the button to go to a column to <color=#df840e>locate</color> directly, and multiple clicks will switch among multiple citizens or buildings. The details also include the production, use and inventory of various materials to help you check whether the <color=#df840e>supply</color> of materials meets the demand. In the inventory, you can also set the <color=#df840e>priority</color> of items. The smaller number means the higher priority. You can ban the items if you want them only used for production instead of consumption. In addition, population change curves and unlocked seeds, animals, and blueprints can be checked here.
The most important thing in the game is to ensure the <color=#df840e>happy life of citizens</color>.
The most urgent task in the early stage is to <color=#df840e>satisfy the survival needs of citizens</color>. You need to ensure there are enough <color=#df840e>food, drinking water, housing and heating</color>, otherwise it will be difficult to survive in the harsh environment. You can check the more detailed elaboration on basic survial methods in <color=#df840e>Help - To survive</color>.
After having basic living supplies, we must pay attention to <color=#df840e>the happiness and health</color> of the citizens, develop <color=#df840e>industries</color> to improve the livability, and increase the <color=#df840e>population</color>. You will also need to pay attention to the stress of citizens if you want to increase the population. Higher happiness and health, and more available houses can encourage the citizens to have children. For more information, please check the <color=#df840e>Help - Citizen Stress and Fertility Rate</color>. Citizens need hospitals to treat illnesses and need Herbs and Soaps to maintain their health. Please note that long-term consumption of rough foods can reduce health. Churches can effectively prevent citizens from committing crimes, but higher happiness requires wine, sweets, and high-quality food. In <color=#df840e>Help - Happiness</color> and <color=#df840e>Help - Health</color>, the reasons for the reduction and improvement of happiness and health will be introduced in details.
After the population grows, you can choose the administrator, and talented managers can bring many benefits to your town. When the development of science and technology is slow, education needs to be developed to accelerate the acquisition of technology points. You can choose the industrial chain based on your existing materials and obtain the missing parts through trade. For more information about advanced development, you can check <color=#df840e>Help - Town Development</color>.

Output of Fishing Dock that covers the fishing point increased by 100%. Multiple fishing point won't bring more buff to the same strcture. Fishes will disappear when drought hits the town, and will recover after rainstorm and flood.
After selecting the building, you can rotate the building using the Rotate button and then click to confirm the placement.
The size of Field, Pasture, Road can be determined by you freely but they still have a maximum upper bound. You can drag to determine their size.

Once a structure is built, you can click on it to assign workers or to check for more information including the output statistics for each year. There is a highlighted area surrounding certain structures when you click on them. The output will usually drop if there is overlapped part in the highlighted areas of the same structure.
Know well about your citizens. You can check what problems are bothering them when you can see some prompt icons on the left. You can click it for details.
You can select any citizen to view his/her detailed information, including health, happiness, stamina, carrying capacity, education, efficiency, employment, current tasks, and other statistics.

You need to always pay attention to the state of the citizens. When they are <color=#df840e>thirsty and hungry</color>, they will go home to eat and drink, and when it is cold, they will look for a warm house nearby for <color=#df840e>heating</color>. The initial living resources can be obtained by <color=#df840e>command - collect resources</color>, and the trees, ore and wild vegetables on the ground can be obtained by collecting. Trees, plants and animals in the wild will have new births but they will no longer appear after the ore is mined.

Homeless citizens <color=#df840e>recover physical stamina slower</color> and work inefficiently. Residents with house can quickly regain their stamina and replenish hunger and thirst. After a period of time, citizens will move into a new home closer to their workplaces. Making sure that there are sufficient laborers available can make home relocation faster. The citizens in the house form a family, and children will be born in the family. When the children reach adulthood, they need to move to a new house to form a new family. If you want to <color=#df840e>increase the population</color>, it is best to <color=#df840e>provide new houses</color> for adult children.

There are many ways to obtain food. Gathering and hunting not only can obtain food and some materials, but also <color=#df840e>have the opportunity to obtain seeds and cubs</color>.
<color=#df840e>Gathering</color>: Gathering can provide food, and there is also a probability of obtaining some <color=#df840e>seeds</color>. The gathering union at the Gatherers Hut will actively gather wild plants within the range.
<color=#df840e>Hunting</color>: The Hunters Hut can provide animal by-products such as Meat and Leather, as well as the probability of obtaining animal <color=#df840e>cubs</color>.
<color=#df840e>Field</color>: Once you have the seeds, you can grow crops on the Field. Most of the crops are edible, and there are differences in yield and cold resistance between different crops. The crops needs <color=#df840e>the right season and temperature</color> to sow and grow, and to mature before workers can harvest them. You can also manually harvest the crops with insufficient maturity in advance, but the yield will be reduced. Late or slow sowing may lead to crops not able to be planted fully, and they will mature later. Crops that have not been harvested in winter are likely to <color=#df840e>die</color>. Therefore, sufficient manpower must be allocated to the farmland to ensure the smooth progress of planting and harvesting. But if the farmers can already cover all the work and harvest all the crops before winter in the strcture, assigning more workers will be pointless. During the slack season, farmers will help laborers carry out some handling and gathering work, without having to unemploy them.
<color=#df840e>Animal husbandry</color>: Animal cubs will be needed if you want to raise livestock in the Pasture. You can obtain cubs from both <color=#df840e>hunting and trade</color>. Even a single animal can multiply. When the number of animals is small, multiplying is slower. Note that animals have a certain lifespan, and the animals obtained will die if they are not kept in captivity for a long time. The output of the pasture varies with different animal species. Products such as Eggs and Dried Animal Dung will be produced from <color=#df840e>daily yield</color>, while Meat and Leather will be produced after animals are <color=#df840e>slaughtered</color>. You can manually adjust the number of animals to keep alive and when that number is exceeded all the extra animals are slaughtered. However, if all the animals are slaughtered, you cannot continue to raise the animals.
<color=#df840e>Fishery</color>: The fishing dock is affected by the fishing point bonus and the area of the water area, and the output will decrease when multiple highlighted areas overlap. Fish ponds have more stable output.
<color=#df840e>Orchard</color>: Fruit can also be eaten, but it takes years to wait for the fruit tree to grow up. It can be used as a raw material for many fancy foods.

Water is an important resource for survival. Wells, Large Wells, and Reservoirs (unlocked through tech) are able to produce a large amount of water. When a <color=#df840e>fire</color> happens, Citizens will get water from Wells and Large Wells in order to put out the fire, so please make sure there are enough wells.

When the game starts, examine the map and terrain so you can form the best strategy.
All the hotkeys below are all default, you can change your preferences at any time in Settings.

If there is not enough heating, citizens will <color=#df840e>freeze to death</color>. They will go to warm houses or Boiler Rooms for heating when it is cold. Wood can be collectedd through Foresters Hub or directly command citizens to Fell Trees. <color=#df840e>Chopping House</color> can process Wood or Dry Animal Dung into Domestic Fuel. <color=#df840e>Coal</color> can also be used directly as Domestic Fuel. Coal can be mined after mining is unlocked in Technology. Residential buildings around the Boiler Room will no longer consume Domestic Fuel. In cold weather, citizens often need to keep warm. <color=#df840e>Arranging heating facilities near the work site</color> can improve work efficiency in winter.

Without clothes, <color=#df840e>health will continue to decrease</color>, and it is difficult to do gathering and hunting in remote places in winter. Clothes can allow citizens to <color=#df840e>work outside for longer time</color> in cold weather. Simple clothes can be made in Tailor Shops. Flax, Alpaca Wool, and Leather are materials that can be obtained through gathering and hunting, where there is also a chance to obtain seeds and cubs. More clothes can be obtained in Advanced Tailors and Garment Factories upgraded from Tailors. Source of materials - Sheep can be purchased in trade. Silk and Refined Leather require more technology and industry.
<color=#df840e>Tools have a great boost on work efficiency</color>. They can be made in Smithy, and Forge can also make advanced Tool Kits.

If all warehouses are full and there is no place to store the output materials, production will stall. In this case, <color=#df840e>open-air warehouses should be built as soon as possible</color> to allow temporary storage of materials so that production work can continue and higher-level warehouses can be built. The location of the warehouse is very important to production and life. Materials will be placed in the nearest warehouse. <color=#df840e>If the warehouse is too far away, the efficiency will be greatly reduced</color>. Low-level warehouses have limited capacity, and warehouses with large capacity will be needed to develop the processing industry.

Roads can increase the movement <color=#df840e>speed</color> of citizens, which is <color=#df840e>of great help</color> to production and transportation. Advanced roads will increase the movement speed quite a bit.

<color=#df840e>Long-term consumption of rough foods, no clothes or being hungry</color> are the main reasons for reduced health. Sickness can also reduce health. In addition, there are some random daily events that can reduce health. When health is low, physical exertion will increase and movement speed will decrease, greatly reducing work efficiency. If the health level is too low, a plague will break out. The plague will spread to a large area and easily cause a large number of deaths.

<color=#df840e>Clinics</color> can treat diseases and improve the health of residents in the area, while hospitals can improve even more. <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> can improve health. Herbs can be obtained through gathering. After unlocking the technology, gathering has a lower probability of obtaining herb seeds. You can also buy herb seeds through trade. Once you have the seeds, you can use the Nursery to grow Herbs and have a stable output. In addition, premium items made from Herbs, such as medicated wine and soap, all have health benefits. <color=#df840e>Soap</color> can also improve health. The Fats for making Soap can be obtained by slughtering big animal or at Hunters Hut. The collection of hives and Fishing Ports will also produce raw materials that can be used to make soap. In addition, the <color=#df840e>bathhouse</color> and <color=#df840e>house remodel</color>, as well as some blueprint buildings and the administrator's skill can also improve the health of residents. High health can reduce physical exertion, and citizens can continue to work longer.
When Happiness value is low, the food consumption is sped up, and the crimes may occur when happiness value of citizens is too low.

<color=#df840e>Churches</color> are able to provide basic happiness to Citizens, and people who lives within the range of a Church will not commit crimes. <color=#df840e>Alcohol</color> are goods that can increase happiness. Gathering Oats and Water is all you need to brew it in the Distillery. Oats seeds can be obtained when gathering, and growing Oats will provide a steady supply of alcoholic drinks. <color=#df840e>High-quality Food</color> and <color=#df840e>Candies</color> can also increase Citizens' Happiness. Also, <color=#df840e>Theater</color>, <color=#df840e>house remodel</color>, part of the Blueprint Buildings, and Administrator effects can also improve Happiness. The productivity of citizens increases significantly when the happiness level is extremely high.

Citizen stress is directly related to population growth, <color=#df840e>high stress</color> leads to lower fertility. Improving <color=#df840e>health</color> and <color=#df840e>happiness</color>, eating <color=#df840e>premium foods</color> can significantly reduce stress. Premium housing also greatly help to reduce the stress on citizens. <color=#df840e>Total number of Population</color> also affects citizen's stress. In addition, Ability of some administrator, technology, structure remodel, and blueprint buildings can also reduce the stress on citicens. You need to adjust the stress of citizens, control the population and pay attention to <color=#df840e>the age structure</color> of the urban population. For example, baby boomers can bring in a large workforce in adulthood but it can also cause aging when they get old.
You can swipe the screen with your finger to move the camera.

You can choose your own development route based on existing resources, such as animal husbandry, farmland, fishery etc. You can choose to fully develop various industries to be self-sufficient or you can obtain the materials you lack through trade. If you feel technology is developing slowly, a large number of research institutes or research institutes can be helpful, paper and books can also greatly increse the Tech EXP.

<color=#df840e>Silver coins</color> can be obtained by selling items in <color=#df840e>Trading Post</color>. You can also use silver coin or goods to trade with other Factions. If the transaction reach a certain amount of money, your <color=#df840e>reputation</color> to the faction will increase. You can unlock more buildings and food recipes as you boost your reputation among Factions. In the <color=#df840e>Port</color>, you can either exchange goods <color=#df840e>with goods</color> or <color=#df840e>with silver coins</color> of equal worth. The icon on the timeline in the upper right corner tells you when the upcoming merchant ship will come. Once the icon disappear, the merchant ship will start entering the map to your town. If there is an urgent need for designated items, you can also <color=#df840e>order</color> specific goods with a <color=#df840e>much higher price</color> than normal purchase in merchant ships, and you can <color=#df840e>only purchase them using Silver Coins</color>.

<color=#df840e>When the population grows to a certain level</color>, there will be talented people who you can choose to be the administrator of the town when you have the <color=#df840e>Town Hall</color>. More administrators can be hired as the town grows, with up to 10 administrators to help the town's development after building faction building Great Temple.

Your town can <color=#df840e>take in immigrants to increase population</color> with the <color=#df840e>town hall</color>. Immigrants will visit from time to time, you can see the icon on the timeline in the upper right corner of the page. When the icon disappears, the immigrant enters the map and heads to your town. If you want to control the population, you can choose not accept immigrants.
Even tiny events could become disasters that set back the town's growth, but much of their destruction can be avoided with proper planning.

Occasionally, there might be harvest years where the temperature is particularly suitable and the yield of all crops will be boosted. Stresss on the food supply can be relieved significantly in these circumstances.

Crops will be affected by temperature, so they will be killed by the coldness in winter if they haven't been harvested. To counter this, you can harvest the crops in advance, or stock enough food to avoid food shortage.

When a snowstorm comes, it will become extremely cold outside. Settlers without proper clothes will have to stay indoors to keep warm, preventing them to go out and work. High quality clothes allow them to work longer under such conditions. When it is cold, if there is not enough fuel for heating, settlers are likely to freeze to death. High quality housing consumes less fuel and ensures that the house is kept warm.

Citizens in poor health have a higher chance of developing illnesses than citizens in good health. Good health can be maintained through advanced food, Herbs, soap and bathhouse. Hospitals and clinics can be used to treat plague outbreaks. Trading with merchants or inviting immigrants into town can increase the spread of diseases.

Tornados are rare and powerful. They can destroy fields and buildings and carry away your citizens and livestock. You can prepare Interim Housings in preparation, which can temporarily house families while the town is being rebuilt.
You can rotate the camera by dragging the screen with both fingers.
Fires may break out from time to time. If a fire does break out, citizens will use water from the nearest well to prevent it from spreading.

Living Fuel: Processed from wood and dried manure. Used for housing heating. Coal: Produced from Large Mines. Used for processing fuel, ink, furnace fuel, etc. Leather: Obtained from slaughtering animals. Used for making clothes, high-class furniture, and luxury goods, etc. Wool: Obtained from raising sheep. Used for making clothes and fabrics, etc. Food: Obtained from gathering, planting, fishing, hunting, and farming. Can replenish Fullness. Water: Obtained from Wells. Can quench Thirst, produce liquor, beverages, ink, etc. Herb: Obtained from gathering or planting. Can improve citizens' health and make advanced medicines, etc. Soap: Produced from Soap Factory. Can improve the health of citizens. Tool: Produced from Blacksmith. Can improve Citizens' productivity. Drinks: Produced from Distillery and Tea Shop. Can improve Citizens' Health. Masonry: Produced from Masonry Workshop. Used in Building and Cobbled Roads construction. Paper: Produced from Paper Mill; Can improve the efficiency of gaining Tech EXP in Schools, Research Institutes, and Research Academies. Ink: Produced from Printing House. Can make books. Books: Produced from Printing House; Can improve the efficiency of gaining Tech EXP in Research Academies. Plank: Produced from Sawmill. Used in Building construction and to craft furniture, etc. Furnace Fuel: Produced from Furnace Plants. Used in auxiliary smelters and other productions. Glass: Produced from Kiln Factory. Used in Building construction, etc. Brick: Produced from Kiln Factory. Used in Building construction, etc. Steel: Produced from Smelter. Used in Building construction and to craft Tools, etc. Glass Bottle: Produced from Kiln Factory. Can craft Portable Lamp. Lamp Oil: Produced from Lamp Factory. Can craft Portable Lamp. Building Kits: Produced from Forges; used for building construction, etc. Sand: Produced from Clay Workshop. Can craft Glass, etc. Clay: Produced from Clay Workshop. Can craft Brick, etc. Silver Ore: Produced from Large Mines. Can craft Silver Cutlery, etc. Gold Ore: Produced from Gold Prospector's Hut. Can build Gold Avenue. Jade: Produced from produced through the Jade Workshop. Can build White Jade Avenue.
<color=#df840e>F11</color> will allow you to go into landscape mode, hide all the menus and see your town closely.
Click the <color=#df840e>Citizen View</color> button in the Citizen Details to observe the citizen's daily life and work.

Drought will lead to lack of water. Water structures will stop working due to lower water levels, merchant ships will be stranded, bonus to fishing resources will be permanently lost, and yields from farmlands will also decrease. During this time, citizens can only utilize the groundwater from wells.
You can zoom in and out by holding the screen open or close with both fingers.

Production of Field, Farm,Grove, Nursery and Forest Farm improved by 50%. Around the resource spot, the buff-covered area will appear when building this type of structure. Whenever a grid of structure landed on the area, a grid of extra output can be gained. Will disappear after a certain amount of time.

Production of Pasture, Eco-Pasture and Corral improve by 50%. Resource points will show the buff-covered area when building this type of structure. Extra output depends on the number of grids a structure lands on the buff-covered area. Will disappear after a certain amount of time.
A wild animal that can be captured 100% by hunters after building a Hunters Hut. The resource point will disappear once the animal dies naturally.
A wild plant whose seeds can be obtained 100% by the gatherers after building a Gatherers Hut or manually sending laborersto gather it. Resource point will disappear if the plant dies.
Citizens are starving and require food. If they do not get food soon, their HP will start to decrease. When their HP reaches 0, they will die of starvation.
Housing Domestic Fuel reserves are low. Without supplementary fuel, citizens might freeze to death.
The warehouse has reached its storage capacity.
You must select a formula for this structure to operate.
No workers have been assigned to this structure.
Processing has been suspended due to a shortage of materials.
The output limit had been reached. Production has been suspended.
The building reserves for Large Mines and Large Quarries ran out and could no longer be used. These buildings cannot be dismantled.
This building is due to be demolished.
The durability of this building is low.
Citizens are thirsty and require drinking water. If they do not get water soon, their HP will start to decrease. When HP reaches 0, they will die of thirst.
The durability of this building has reached 0. The structure cannot be used anymore.
This structure is on fire, which will spread over time.
Set this task as a priority for the workers.
Farmers do not work during the slack season (plants won't grow in winter). And they will work as laborers instead.
The total reserve of Herbs is low.
The total reserve of Timber is low.
The total reserve of Stone is low.
Citizens are freezing and need to get warm. If they cannot get warm soon, their HP will start to decrease. When HP reaches 0, they will freeze to death.
The total reserve of fuel is low.
New animals have been acquired through various means.
New seeds have been acquired through various means.
The merchant ship has arrived. You can make purchases or cancel the trade at dock.
Immigrants have arrived. You can grant or refuse them citizenship at the Town Hall.
It's time to harvest the crops.
Some children have grown up and would like their own houses.
The town lacks repairmen. Buildings might fall into disrepair or ruin.

There are citizens without houses to live in who can only recover stamina by loafing around. They can only get warm at other citizens' homes and get food and water from the warehouse. Homeless citizens cannot have children.
Lack of clothing, easy to get freeze and death.
Citizens are sick and need to be treated immediately. Normal disease makes them move slowly, the plague could spread and cause mass death.
Citizens have no tools to work with and are using their bare hands. Their work efficiency is significantly reduced.
Citizens have nowhere to work. They have nothing to do but to help the laborers. Please build a workplace for them as soon as possible.
Housing food reserves are low. Without supplementary food, citizens might die of starvation.
Housing water reserves are low. Without supplementary water, citizens might die of thirst.
A product has not been selected
The yield limit has been reached
You have acquired an animal cub
You have acquired new crop seeds
The autumn harvest is about to begin
A citizen has become an adult

You can ask laborers to gather wild vegetables or place orders with the merchant ships to get food more quickly. The Hunters Hut, Gatherers Hut, and fishing dock produce food each month. Fields, Orchards, and pastures have high yields but require a long time to mature before they can be harvested.
Keep an eye on Domestic Fuel reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from residential areas.
You can manually choose to enable or suspend operations of a structure, but remember, if you suspend operartions you will need to make arrangements for the workers.
You require new warehouses for storage.
No formula has been selected. You must select a product for the structure.
You must assign more workers to this profession.
Keep an eye on material reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from houses and processing type buildings.
You must adjust the limit to allow operations to continue.
This structure can no longer be used. Remember to make arrangements for its workers.
You can use the Cancel command to abort the demolition.
Pay attention to the number of repairmen to avoid using dangerous structures.
You can quickly build a supply of drinking water by constructing wells and assigning water fetchers to gather it. You can also use coins to order drinking water.
A ruined building needs to be rebuilt by the builders.
Can be manually enabled or disabled.
Place a well nearby to extinguish the fire.
Prioritizing new events will lower the priority assigned to previous ones.
Keep an eye on fertility rates. If population growth is not keeping up with residential construction, building work can be postponed.
You can reassign farmers to temporarily assist with other work.
Technology Points can be used in Town Technology.
In the early stages, the Gatherers Hut can be used as a source of Herbs. Later, obtaining herb seeds through trade or tech will allow you to grow large amounts of Herbs in the Nursery.
Timber can be acquired by cutting down trees. Forest farms have high outputs.
Stone can be collected in the wild, but mining at a quarry is more efficient and has a higher output.
Produce enough clothing and Domestic Fuel can keep citizens warm.
Fuel can be obtained by processing Timber at the Chopping House. The sawmill has a high output.
You can reappoint or replace the administrators at the Town Hall.
Requires a pasture or corral to be raised.
Requires a field, Nursery, or plantation to grow.
Build a dock for the merchant ship to stop at.
Build a Town Hall and wait for the immigrants to arrive.
All farmland crops will be harvested in the autumn harvest.
Build new houses for citizens to live in.
Assign repairmen to maintain your town's structures.
Cancel some Citizens' work to make them laborers.
Constructing houses or Interim Housings can solve this problem, however ordinary Interim Housings affect citizens' desire to have children.

Tailors make clothing and backpacks. Basic clothing protects citizens in the winter and allows them to work outside, reducing their chances of freezing to death. Advanced clothing also increases happiness, though you will need to upgrade the Tailors to unlock advanced tailoring techniques. Advanced tailors can make all kinds of clothing. Backpacks allow citizens to carry more weight and largely increase transportation efficiency.
Clinics and hospitals can treat citizens with diseases.
Tools can be produced by constructing a blacksmith's. The ordering function of trade can be quickly obtained through the use of silver coins.
Click the event bar to view or adjust citizens' professions, adjusting the number of workers a profession as required.
Keep an eye on food reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from residential areas.
Keep an eye on water reserves and ensure warehouses are not too far away from residential areas.

A magical Rubik's Cube worshiped by locals. Anyone who throws a coin into it can make a wish and cause a random item(99) to appear. <color=#df840e>Notice: Magical power is restored once a month.</color>
This structure is disabled in this scenario.
Citizens are in poor health and <color=#df840e>move slower</color>.
Unlocked after completing the research in relevant technology
Event Logs. Click to expand or fold. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
Map. Monitor the terrain and the distribution of structures and resources. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
Profession. You can adjust the number of jobs available in each profession. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
Survivors have chosen a place to settle down, but there are more challenges ahead waiting for them.
Please slide your finger on the screen to select an appropriate settlement on the map.
Technology. Use <color=#df840e>Tech Points</color> to unlock new technology. <color=#df840e>Schools</color> can generate <color=#df840e>Tech EXP</color>. (<color=#df840e>{0}</color>)
Hunting Point: Hunter 100% acquires animal cub here.
Fertile Soil: Production of Field,grove and Farm increases by 50%.
Fishing Point: Output from Fishing Dock increases by 100%.
Grassland: Output from Pasture increases by 50%.
Seeds Point: Gatherer can 100% get seeds here.
Appointing a new administrator will makes the current one leave. This won't cost any silver coin.
A experienced gravedigger can always find something useful in a mound. Of course digging it out is more beneficial to the development of the town than letting it sleep underground!
A descendant of the oldest family in town. He can use mysterious rituals passed down through generations to change the local climate when the cold winter is coming.
The fastest worker in town! It only takes him one month to go around the town carrying a bucket of water.
A experienced businessman who maintains good relationships with trade caravans. He could bring more business opportunities.
A fortunate miner who have experienced many accidents without being injured, believing that safety measures can help people survive the mine accidents or even meteorites.
A excellent forest ranger focuses on the planting and conservation of trees at Foresters Hut, firmly believing that trees will grow faster and better as long as they are nurtured by people.
Born in poverty and survived from the most difficult period by extramely saving living materials. These things can be used for much longer than they seem.
Worked in farmland for many years and is very knowledgeable in planting and cultivating crops, hoping to pass on knowledge to everyone.
Worked in fruit forests for many years and is very knowledgeable in planting and cultivating various fruit trees, hoping to pass on knowledge to everyone.
Worked in the ranch for many years and is very knowledgeablein raising and breeding livestock and poultry, hoping to pass on knowledge to everyone.
Collectors who have a good knowledge of field materials can help workers in cities and towns make better use of natural resources.
Experienced builders know how to save materials in the construction process. Reasonably using less materials will not affect the quality of the building, will it?
Experienced craftsmen, who are very knowledgeable about the processing procedures of various objects, can help the workers engaged in processing to perform more efficient work.
One who loves soybeans so much that believed soybeans is the best crop in the world and should be grown on every farm then all can eat their fill.
One who loves bread so much that believed wheat is the best crop in the world and should be grown on every farm then everyone can eat bread.

One who used to be a tobacco trader believes tobacco is excellent goods. Planting tobacco in large quantities will certainly bring a lot of wealth to the town. Of course, Tobacco is not meant to be eaten.
Herdsmen who have worked in pastures for many years, have a lot of experience with raising cattle.
Can be a school teacher for many years, the development program focused on education have greatly contributed to technology in towns and cities.
Scholars adept at commerce-related affairs, trade affairs of the town would be benefitted from commerce-focusing guidelines.
Scholars adept at education-related affairs, education of the town would be benefitted from science-focusing guidelines.
Scholars adept at mining affairs, mining affairs of the town would be benefitted from resource develeopment-focusing guidelines.
Scholars adept at construction affairs construction of the town would be benefitted from infrastructure-focusing guidelines.
Scholars adept at agriculture affairs, agriculture affairs of the town would be benefitted from agriculture-focusing guidelines.
Scholars adept at processing-related affairs, processing industry of the town would be benefitted from processing-focusing guidelines.
Scholars adept at logistics-related affairs, logistics of the town would be benefitted from logistics-focusing guidelines.
Scholars who have a lot of research on livability, development programs that focus on education have greatly contributed to the livability of towns.
Herbalists who master ancient formulas can bring stronger physiques to citizens.
Pay attention to food storage and civic diet.
Can live in arid areas and cherish water resources.
Can live in cold area, now extremely care about heat preservation measures.
Skilled worker who focus on summarization of experience and have published books on how to learn from experience, which is popular among the public.
Can be a researcher at the Institute and was able to lead the research and development of scientific research projects, focus on scientific and technological research projects.
Can be a home decoration worker, focus on comfortable home envIronment.
Believe that population is the basis of the labor force and encourage people to have children.
Believed that the admission of immigrants is conducive to diversified development and will formulate policies to accept more immigrants.
Has a high reputation among the citizens and is loved by all.
A trader who focuses on luxury goods and do business with the wealthiest merchants only. He can attract more affluent caravans to the town.
Can be a doctor, cares about the healthy life of the citizens and focus on the development of medicine.
Can be a businessman but was running out of money in charity, hopes all the people a happy life.
Used to be an opera actor, focus on development of culture and art. Rich entertainment life greatly reduced the stress of the citizens.
Interval between the arrival of merchant ship: <color=#df840e> -10%</color>
Duration of tools, clothes and backpacks: <color=#df840e>+20</color>
Activate a random unlocked technology (Reappointment invalid)
{0} immigrants applied to settle in the town.
Check for Auto-Reappointment (5000 coins each time)
The administrator has retired. Do you want to appoint his son as his successor?
Choose a scenario, lead the people, and build \nyour own town.
If you are playing this game for the first time, we strongly recommend you turn on the Guides.
Are you sure you want to delete this saved data?
The deleted saves cannot be restored. Are you sure you want to delete them?
This key is being used. Do you want to change the keybind into this function?
Settings haven't been applied. Apply current settings?
If enabled, usually set it to setting 1. Setting 2, 3 and 4 will consume less power but frame rate of the game will drop. When enabled, the frame rate setting does not take effect.
Can be obtained from trade or gathering in the wild.
Can be obtained from Hunters Hut.
Can be obtained from trade or hunters hut.
Can be obtained from trade or game start at low difficulty.
Can be obtained from trade or technology.
<color=#df840e>Saliva-borne: Tuberculosis</color> Can only be treated at the <color=#df840e>Hospital</color>. Unlockable in <color=#df840e>Technology - Livability - Bathhouse</color>.
<color=#df840e>Air-borne: Pandemic Flu</color> Can only be treated at the <color=#df840e>Hospital</color>. Unlockable in <color=#df840e>Technology - Livability - Pharmacy</color>.
Storage exceeds the upper limit, can not be trade
Housing can only be built within the market places.
Laborers can mainly collecting materials on the ground and help the town's logistics system.
Gatherers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
Transfer station workers increase the logistical proficiency of the town.
Cooks work at the gourmet shop and produce various advanced delicacies which increase citizens' happiness. Some special foods increase multiple different stats.
Cooks increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Leatherworkers work at the Leatherware Hut and the Leather Shop, they process ordinary Leather into Refined Leather and other Leather product.
Leatherworkers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Shop assistants work at the luxury store and sell rare, luxury items, designed primarily for trade. Luxury items are a main source of silver coins.
Shop assistants increase the trading proficiency of the town.
Silkworm farmers work at the silkworm shed and produce silk for the production of advanced textiles.
Silkworm farmers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
Actors work at theaters and perform shows, which largely increase citizens' happiness. Theatres serve a limited area. Building more theatres will help generate higher levels of happiness.

Fishermen work in various fishing industries. The fishing dock is the primary structure in the early stages and its yield is related to the area of water that it covers. As fishing boats are usually some distance from the city, paving roads or building warehouses nearby can reduce transportation times. Upgrading the fishing industry as early as possible allows you to construct advanced fishing structures which significantly increase the yield of the fishermen. You can further boost the output by using fishing nets. Once upgraded to the Fishing Port, fishermen can sail out to sea to fish.
Actors increase the Livability proficiency of the town.
Delivery center workers work at the delivery center. They transport designated items from all storage structures on the map to nearby production buildings.
Supply station workers increase the logistical proficiency of the town.
Mint workers make silver coins, which can be used as a common currency for trade.
Mint workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Jewelry workers work at the jewelry workshop and make jade, silver, and gold sand into jewelry for trading, which is an important source of silver coins.
Jewelry workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Carvers work at the Carving Workshop and process various raw materials into statues for trade. Statues are one of the main sources of silver coins.
Carvers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Gold miners work at the gold miner's cabin and pan sand for gold sand, which can be used to build structures or pave gold avenues.
Fishermen increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
Gold miner increases the processing proficiency of the town.
Jade workers work at the jade house and search for jade in stone, which can be used to build structures or pave jade avenues.
Jade worker increases the processing proficiency of the town.
Beverage workers work at the tea shop and process raw materials into coffee, tea, and other beverages.
Beverage workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Boilermen mainly work in the boiler room, to heat the citizens with hot water. It can ensure that the buildings within the range remain warm and no need to use Domestic Fuel.
Boilermen increase the livability proficiency of towns during their work.

The sheriff is responsible for the security of the city. When a crime is committed, the sheriff can find out who the offender is and mark it for you. However, it's up to you to decide what to do with the crime. Exile crime can get him out of town but it's also a way to increase his happiness to stop him from committing a crime.

Hunters work at the Hunters Hut, which is also a resting place for them. They search the whole map for prey, and then hunt or catch it. Although there are no area restrictions as to where hunters can work, they cannot cross the river without bridges. Connecting land masses via bridges as early as possible will help increase hunters' output. When a hunter's inventory is full, they must return to a cabin, so constructing additional Hunters Huts or warehouses will also increase their output.
Hunters increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

The primary functions of Lumber Mill is to chop wood to produce Living Fuel. Lumber Mill can process Wood and Dried Manure to make them burn more efficiently. Industrial Upgrade allows the Lumber Mill to craft Planks for construction. Workers working on Water Sawmills will have higher productivity by utilizing water power.
Woodcutters increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Foresters' job is far more than felling trees. As the guardians of nature, they only cut down the mature trees and periodically plant saplings to replace them. Of course, trees do not grow very fast... Typically, the area around a Foresters Hut will not be a lush forest. In order to maintain the ecological balance, the output of Timber is of course not high. For higher yields, you can develop technology in the early stages to unlock forest farms. Once trees are mature, foresters can cut them down, providing a steady supply of Timber.
Foresters increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

Herbalists are familiar with Herbs and collect the supply essential for maintaining a healthy population. Herbalists do not plant Herbs. Once you have obtained herb seeds, you can assign farmers to grow them in the Nursery.
In circumstances where workers in other professions cannot do their job, they will help the laborers with their work.
Herbalists increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

A miner's job includes high levels of physical work. They can work at various mines and you will need to assign enough manpower to ensure a steady output. Ore is heavy and mines are built in remote areas. Building advanced roads, placing nearby warehouse or advanced storage structures as soon as possible can significantly increase their output.
Miners increase the mining proficiency of the town.

Quarrymen will be working in all kinds of quarries, which require a lot of manpower in order to guarantee stable production. Stones are the main consumables in the early game. Laborers can be dispatched to clean up and gather Stones in the map. However, in order to secure a sustained and stable output, a Large Quarry needs be built.
Quarrymen will improve the settlement's mining proficiency as they work.

Blacksmiths turn metal into tools, they can also make stone tools, however, these are not as durable. Iron and Steel tools are a blacksmith's main product. Citizens without tools have low work efficiency. Construct a blacksmith as soon as possible to ensure a healthy supply of tools and improve the development of the town.
Blacksmiths increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Brewers make liquor, which is an important source of happiness for citizens. They use different materials to make different varieties of alcohol. The seeds of raw materials can be collected in the wild or purchased from merchant ships. Breweries require a large amount of water, to ensure the supply of liquor you will need a steady supply of both water and raw materials. Advanced liquor provides additional happiness.
Brewers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Tailors make clothing and backpacks. Basic clothing protects citizens in the winter and allows them to work outside, reducing their chances of freezing to death. You will need to upgrade the Tailors to unlock advanced tailoring techniques. Advanced tailors can make all kinds of clothing. Backpacks allow citizens to carry more weight and largely increase transportation efficiency.

Builders play a central role in developing the town. They can build structures from scratch: clearing sites, transporting materials, and constructing structures. If they are short-handed, laborers will help them with clearing the site and transporting materials. You can cancel a construction at any time. You can prioritize structures for builders to work on if there are many sites and too few workers to cover all of them at once.
Tailors increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Vendors work at the marketplace. They move daily supplies from warehouses to the market where citizens in the area can freely use whatever they need. Vendors organize and collect resources so that the citizens do not need to waste time running between different warehouses. Once you unlock Delivery, vendors can deliver goods directly to houses. Citizens will be able to use daily necessities at home without going to the market or the warehouse, which significantly cuts down their time spent traveling.
Vendors increase the trading proficiency of the town.

Traders are responsible for making transactions and moving goods. Traders will sell designated goods which could be primary resources or goods made exclusively for sale. The value of tradable goods is much higher than that of primary resources. Citizens do not rely on tradable goods for survival, so they are the best source of silver coins. Goods purchased from merchant ships will be stored at the dock and can only be used after traders have transported them to warehouses.
Traders increase the trading proficiency of the town.

Teachers educate citizens and produce Tech EXP for the town. They teach students and impart knowledge in schools. Only educated adults can be assigned as teachers. The town's first generation of adults are all educated. The output of Technology Experience is related to the educational building. Consuming paper will accelerate the production of Technology Experience.
Teachers increase the science proficiency of the town.

Doctors work at clinics and hospitals, and play an important role in maintaining citizens' health. They can treat diseases and plagues with medication. A doctor can only treat a limited number of patients. Each hospital covers the healthcare of specific citizens, so doctors can only treat citizens covered by the hospital they work at. In the event of a disease outbreak or plague, hospitals will treat all citizens equally, however, treatment will still consume medical resources. Ensure that all citizens have healthcare to maintain the overall health levels of the town.
Doctors increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

Clerics preach religion to citizens. They work in churches, which can serve a limited area. Citizens will visit churches and develop religious beliefs, which will largely reduce crime rates. If all citizens become believers, there will be no more crime.
Builders increase the construction proficiency of the town.
Clerics increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

Scrub workers work at the bathhouse. They use water or soap to clean citizens, which helps prevent disease and can significantly increase health levels. Each bathhouse has limited space so a bathhouse only serve a limited area. To increase the health of all citizens, you must construct a sufficient number of bathhouses. Higher reserves of soap will result in citizens washing more often and largely increase health, which can replace the need for Herbs.
Scrub workers increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

Water Fetchers mainly work in wells to produce stable drinking water for citizens. Please noted that, water is also part of the production material for products except being a drinking resource. In addition, when the fire comes, the well can also be used for fire fighting. Spreading wells near various buildings is an effective measure to deal with fires.
Water fetchers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

Bartenders work in taverns, which provide a place for drinking and partying, and greatly increase citizens' happiness. Taverns have limited space and adopt a membership system, accomodating a certain number of citizens. To increase the happiness of all citizens, you must construct a sufficient number of taverns.
Bartenders increase the Livability proficiency of the town.

Repairmen fix structural wear caused by years of use and weather damage (even unused structures require upkeep). Ruined structures should be demolished and rebuilt by builders. The work of repairmen is inconspicuous but vital. Repairing buildings when there is only slight wear and tear does not consume materials. When the structure is ruined, it requires construction materials to repair it.
Repairmen increase the construction proficiency of the town.

Apiarists work at the apiary. Note that beehives will spawn on mature trees, but dense forest may also hinder the production of hives. So, not recommend to be near a Foresters Hut. Apiarists collect honey for food and beeswax for processing of lamp oil.

Farmers are the main labor force in agricultural production and play an important role in generating food supplies. They can work in fields or in Orchards. Farming requires seeds, which can be found in the wild, or purchased from merchant ships. Fields have busy seasons as well as slack seasons. There are three stages to the busy season: sowing, farming, and harvesting. In the slack season, farmers will help laborers to transport goods. After upgrading the industry, farmers can grow Herbs and advanced materials in nurseries and plantations. It takes years for fruit trees to grow. When they are mature, they will produce fruit whenever the temperature is favorable.
Apiarists increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

Weavers process fabric raw materials into textile products at the Textile Mill. Advanced textile products require special raw materials, most of which can be grown in fields. Weavers at the Textile Water Mill generate a higher output due to their use of water power.
Weavers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Fuel workers work at Fuel Factory, processing Timber or coal into Refined Fuels, which are only for industrial use. Refined Fuels produce materials crucial to industrial processing.
Fuel workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Mill workers process wheat and malt, providing raw materials for bread-making and liquor production. A watermill uses water power and is more efficient.
Mill workers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Bakers work in Bakeries and Pastry Shops and are able to use flour to produce more High-quality Food. High-quality Food can increase Citizens' Happiness, and some can even relieve Citizens' stress.
Bakers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Butchers work at Butcher. They cut the meat from animals slaughtered by the hunters in the pasture. Cut meat provides more energy and can feed more citizens.
Farmers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
Butchers increase the processing proficiency of the town during work.
Worker can process Milk into Butter, and process Fat into Soap.
Soap makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Sugarmakers extract sugar from beets for the production of advanced food.
Sugarmakers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Jam makers extract jam from fruits for the production of advanced food.
Jam makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Salt makers work at Saltworks. They extract salt from water for curing meat.
Salt makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Meat curers work at curing workshops. They use salt to make salted meat and salted fish, which are tastier and can be easily preserved.

Herdsmen raise animals. Both livestock and wild animal cubs can be raised in the pasture. Hunters can acquire wild animals through hunting, however, livestock can only be obtained from merchant ships, either through purchase or by ordering. Most animals produce meat and additional materials. A few animals do not produce meat, for example, cows mainly produce Milk. Pastures require herdsmen to take care of the animals and make them reproduce. The reproduction mechanism in the game functions via mitosis and mating is not required. The more the herdsmen, the more efficient production.
Meat curers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Reed farmers work in reed fields, which can be built near rivers and yield reeds stably. The reed farmers regularly collect reeds, which can be used in Knitting Workshop and Textile Mills for production.
The working reed farmers can increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
Knitters work at Knitting Workshop. They can process raw materials into ropes and make ropes into fishing nets for the fishermen.
Knitters increase the processing proficiency of the town.

The Smelter is one of the main production lines in industrial production, and various basic raw materials can be processed by it to produce large number of raw materials for a buildings and high-end industries. These materials included Glass, Steel and Bricks. The Smelter can also further process the Glass into Glass Bottles, which can be used to produce Portable Lamps and other glass products.
Smelters increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Dredger work at sandpits. They collect sand and clay from water which are both important materials in industrial production. Occasionally they will find gold sand in the sand, but only in very small proportions.
Dredger will gradually increase the Mining Proficiency of the town during work.
Papermakers work at paper mills and printing factories. They can process Timber or reeds into paper or books, and turn coal and water into ink, which is mainly used for education and research.
Herdsmen increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.
Papermakers increase the processing proficiency of the town.

Researchers work at research institutes and academies. Their research on society and science provides a large amount of Technology Experience, which significantly increases the speed of town development. The output of points from each researcher is limited, but using paper and books can greatly improve their efficiency.
Researchers increase the educational proficiency of the town.
Candy makers work at candy workshops. They can make fancy like candy and chocolates, sugared ration grants happiness bonus.
Candy makers's work process increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Can-makers work at canneries and can make all kinds of cans. Canned food provides more energy and allows citizens to work outside for longer periods.
Can-makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Bedding makers work at Bedding Shop. They can process Linen and Cotton Cloth into Bedding Set, which are necessary for advanced buildings.
Textile makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Furniture makers work at furniture factories and produce all kinds of furniture, which is necessary for advanced buildings. Luxury furniture can also be sold for silver coins.

Gatherers work at the Gatherers Hut, which should be placed in a wooded area. Gatherers will search the area around the station for plants, including wild vegetables, raw materials for the brewery, textile materials, and so on. Notice that the wild plants grow with the trees. If too many trees are cut down, there will be no more wild plants for gatherers to collect. Gatherers Huts are most effective in the early stages, due to the abundance of forested areas, but be careful to avoid overlapping stations, as this will reduce the overall yield.
Furniture makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Light makers work at lighting factories to produce lamp oil and lanterns.
Light makers increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Potters process raw materials into pottery, which is primarily used as tradable goods. Pottery is the main source of silver coins.
Potters increase the processing proficiency of the town.
Masons can process stone into Masonry, which can be used for road construction and advanced building construction.
Masons will improve the settlement's processing proficiency as they work.
Fishpond workers work at the fishpond. They are land-based fishermen and provide a steady supply of fish.
Fishpond workers increase the agricultural proficiency of the town.

Transfer station workers work at the transfer station. Laborers move items to the transfer station, which is similar to a warehouse, while station workers deliver resources to warehouses outwith the immediate area.

Remodel the structure with Building Kit to strengthen its stability to withstand wind and rain, thus it will not be damaged or destroyed.
Remodel the house with Luxury Bedding, thus increase max occupants number of the house.
Remodel the structure with Brick Kiln to get the fire burning stronger, thus improve the work efficiency.
Remodel the structure with Medical Soap used by masseur to better keep citizens clean and healthy.
Remodel the house with Furniture to improve the coziness, thus increase the happiness of occupants.
Remodel the house with Luxury Furniture to further improve the coziness, thus greatly increase the happiness of occupants.
Remodel the structure with Lanterns to impove the lighting of working environment so miners and quarrymen could dig deeper, thus improve the work efficiency.
Disinfect the clinic or hospital with Medical Alcohol to provide a healthier place for treatement, thus improve citizens' health.
Loosen the soil on farm, Orchard, forest farm or pasture, thus improve workers' work efficiency.
Remodel the structure with Steel Tool to make the citizen's work easier, thus improve work efficiency.
Remodel the structure with Books to improve the generation efficiency of technology points.
Remodel the warehouse with Bricks to consolidate it, thus can accommodate more items.
Make baits using Fodder to lure fish, thus improve fishing efficiency.
Remodel the costumes in theater with Gowns. Improve the buff scope of theater.
Remodel the cellar with tools to accommodate more items.
Taking a basket while gathering. Improve gathering efficiency.
Remodel the Hunters Hut with Traps. Increase probability of obtaining cubs from hunting.
Raising a cat in house can release occupants' stress.
Signing new employment contracts can increase the maximum workers of in buildings.
Remodel the structure with Tool Kit to reduce materials consumed for production, which is only effective for raw materials that reached 5 or more numbers in recipes.
By increasing the number of academic dress, the school can admit more students for study.
Remodel the church with Bell Towers to carry out missionary work in a larger scope.
Remodel the house with Toilet to provide residents with sanitary places thus increase their health.
Remodel the Field, Farm, Orchard or Forest Farm with Scarecrow to drive away seed-eating birds thus increase output.
Remodel the mill and reservoir with Gear to make the rotation more smooth thus improve its work efficiency.
Remodel the structure with Oven to improve the work efficiency of some processing buildings.
Remodel houses with Bedding. Increase max occupant number of the house.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Potatoes. Cold-resistant.
Field crops that yield oats. Can be used for brewery.
Field crops that yield soybeans. High yield.
Field crops that yield winter squashes. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Field crops that yield lettuces. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Field crops that yield tomatoes. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Field crops that yield sugar beets.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Peas. Higher yield than vegetables. Productions are slightly higher than Vegetables and Staple Food, but lower than Soybeans.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Coffee Beans.
Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Tobacco.
Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Tea Leaves.
Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Cocoa Beans.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Apples.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Cherries.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Chestnuts.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Peaches.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Pears.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Broccoli. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Pecans.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Plums.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Grapes. Can be used for brewery.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Maple Sap.
Seeds planted in Orchard that yield Mulberry Leaves.
Seeds planted in Forest Farm that yield Timber.
Seeds planted in Nursery that grow into decorative Saplings.
Seeds planted in Nursery that yield Herbs.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Hay.
Seeds planted in Field that yield corn. High-yield crop.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Chili. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Pumpkins. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Wheat. Can be used for brewery.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Cabbages. Fast-maturing but low yield.
Seeds planted in Field that yield Agave. Can be used for brewery.
{0} the {1} has been sacrificed for the happiness of the town.
March is the time of planting. You can increase or decrease the number of farmers according to the food reserves.
Make sure the citizens have access to heating in winter.
The autumn harvest is about to start. Assigning more farmers will speed up the harvest.
Citizens need warm clothes to work outside in the winter.

Trees grow slowly on Easter Island, so structures that grow trees are disabled in this scenario.Easter Island is a sea island, so land trade is disabled and the interval between sea trading stations is increased. Some technologies are already unlocked at the beginning of the game.Easter Island is densely forested, so the construction of fields and pastures will destroy the local ecology and affect the growth of trees. Completing the scenario will unlock the unique wonder of Easter Island: Easter Island Statue.
The rise and fall of the Vikings.
The rise and fall of the Middle Ages.

In sandbox mode, you'll start with all the technologies unlocked and can build structures without any building materials and building stages. In addition, you will be able to dig rivers and change the terrain.
The Vikings invaded the coasts of Europe and the British Isles from the 8th to the 11th century, covering a wide area from the European mainland to the Arctic.
It began with the fall of the Western Roman Empire in 476 A.D. and ended with the fall of the Eastern Roman Empire in 1453 A.D. when it was assimilated into the Renaissance and the age of navigation.

Since the time when the islanders landed on the island, they have built their homes for survival and can survive on the island. Now they are preparing to build stone statues by the sea for their faith. Now they need you to help them build the stone statues!
The construction of the Moai stone statue
Need Builders of Island to carve the stone to statues.
Need the builders on the island to carry ropes and roll logs
Need the builders on the island to erect the stone statue
The carving of the first stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The carving of the fourth stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The fourth stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
A group of colonists have arrived and burned the planks for recording. The villagers lose happiness. Do you treat them with hospitality or deport them?
A merchant ship from the ocean has arrived. They have brought some sheep and want to trade with the Easter Island. Do you accept the trade?

Congratulations on constructing the imperfect statues, but life is not over for the Easter Islanders. As the population increases, the competiton for resources get more and more intense. Some of them even start to eat their own kind. The Easter Island, whose population has once reached over 30,000, eventually ends in tragedy, with only a few hundred people left.
The carving of the fifth stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The fifth stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
A group of colonists have arrived. Do you treat them with hospitality or deport them?
The carving of the sixth stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The sixth stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.

The priest propose to carry out the Birdman Warrior Event to find the strongest warrior of the tribe. The event has risks, but the those who survive will bring good things. Do you want to hold the event?
The carving of the seventh stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The first stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
The seventh stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.

Contratulations on constructing the perfect statues, but life is not over for the Easter Islanders. As the population increases, the competition for resources get more and more intense. Some of them even start to eat their own kind. The Easter Island, whose population has once reached over 30,000, eventually ends in tragedy, with only a few hundred people left.
The first stone statue has been built, and the priest suggests using the ancient ritual script to record the great move. Do you want to record it on the wood planks?
The carving of the second stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The second stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
Without enemies, the rats on the island are rapidly multiplying. As a result, the fruit trees cannot produce food and the rats are eating the tree seeds. Would you consider eating rat meat?
The carving of the third stone statue is finished. You need to use a large amount of logs and ropes to transport the statue to the sea.
The third stone statue has been transported to the sea. Now you need to assign workers to set it up.
The propagation of doctrines will strengthen religious belief and double the construction speed of the statue. Do you want to start the propagation?
Sheep acquired; Dock and Grocery store unlocked
Complete the challenge and quit Easter Island scenario
Complete the challenge and quit Easter Island scenario

Some villagers die of desperate resistance
The merchant ship leaves and will never arrive again

Unlock the <color=#df840e>Transportation Port</color> and the <color=#df840e>Land Transportation Station</color>.

<color=#df840e>Boiler Room</color> <color=#df840e>can provide insulation</color> to the buildings in its zone of effect. When Boiler Room is enabled and working, houses around will stop consuming Domestic Fuel themselves while keep being insulated.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Kiln Factory</color>, which can produce <color=#df840e>brick and glass</color>.
You can transform mountains or rivers into flat ground.
All industries get equipment upgrades and an efficiency boost. Increases the efficiency of production workers by <color=#df840e>25%</color>.
Citizens now have chances to get <color=#df840e>herb seed</color> while collecting Herbs.
Citizens have chances to get <color=#df840e>herb seed</color> while collecting Herbs.

Unlock the <color=#df840e>trap</color> recipe in <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color>, and the <color=#df840e>Scarecrow</color> recipe in <color=#df840e>Knitting Workshop</color>, applying in the <color=#df840e>Structure Remodel</color>.
<color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color> can produce traps now. Unlock trap upgrade options which need traps to <color=#df840e>increase the probability of obtaining Cubs from hunting</color>.
Enlarge citizens package with <color=#df840e>increase citizens' carrying capacity</color>. Citizens will carry products to warehouses <color=#df840e>after their backpack full</color>.
The damaged or destroyed buildings in selected area would be rebuilt automatically.
Scholars has deep research on <color=#df840e>water-borne infectious diseases</color>, it can more effectively treat water-borne infectious diseases.
Fallen beehives or fruit can be found around dead trees. There is a small chance of finding <color=#df840e>fruit tree seeds</color> when gathering fruit.
It can <color=#df840e>greatly accelerate</color> the <color=#df840e>treatment</color> of Water-borne disease:<color=#df840e>cholera</color>.
Scholars has deep research on <color=#df840e>skin disease</color> infectious diseases, it can more effectively treat Skin-borne disease.
It can <color=#df840e>greatly accelerate</color> the <color=#df840e>treatment</color> of Skin-borne disease:<color=#df840e>measles</color>.
It can <color=#df840e>greatly accelerate</color> the <color=#df840e>treatment</color> of Saliva-borne disease:<color=#df840e>tuberculosis</color>.
It can <color=#df840e>greatly accelerate</color> the <color=#df840e>treatment</color> of airborne disease:<color=#df840e>flu</color>.
This feature is only avaliable in sandbox mode.
Clear the reeds by the river to get <color=#df840e>reeds</color>.
You can collect <color=#df840e>reeds</color> as well as fallen fruit and beehives in the wild. There is a chance of getting <color=#df840e>grove seeds</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Leatherware Hut</color> and the <color=#df840e>Luxury Store</color> to produce <color=#df840e>Refined Leather</color> and <color=#df840e>Leather goods</color>
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Jewelry Workshop</color> which produces jewelry for trade.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Textile Mill</color>,<color=#df840e>Advanced Tailor</color> and the <color=#df840e>Textile Water Mill</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Advanced Tailor</color> which can produce a wider variety of clothes.
The output of products other than meat and fat when slaughtered animals <color=#df840e>+100%</color>.
Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>Luxury Coats</color> at the Advanced Tailor.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Clothing Factory</color> which can produce a wider variety of Luxury clothes.
Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>custom gowns</color> at the Clothing Factory.
Clothes are now more beautiful and durable. Durability <color=#df840e>+20%</color>.
Unlock <color=#df840e>Bedding Shop</color> and <color=#df840e>Bedding Factory</color>. Now can use Bedding or Luxury Bedding to <color=#df840e>upgrade houses</color>.
Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>silk</color> at the Textile Mill.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Silkworm Shed and Clothing Factory</color>. Unlock the recipe for making silk at the Textile Mill.
Durability of all structures <color=#df840e>+20%</color>. Possibility of catching fire <color=#df840e> -50%</color>.
There is a chance to find <color=#df840e>cubs</color> during hunting. Cubs can be raised in the <color=#df840e>pasture</color>.
Construction upgrades make the houses more durable. Durability of all structures <color=#df840e>+20%</color>. Possibility of catching fire <color=#df840e> -50%</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Luxury Apartment</color>, where citizens can procreate.
Unlock structure <color=#df840e>Marquee</color>, can be placed out side marketplaces' control zones, cannot be upgraded.
Walking speed of builders and repairmen <color=#df840e>+10%</color>.
Builders and repairmen work harder. Their walking speed <color=#df840e>+10%</color>.
The output of products other than meat and fat from slaughtered animals <color=#df840e>doubles</color>.
The raw materials of the demolished structures can be <color=#df840e>100%</color> recycled.(Not including upgrade materials)
Demolition actions required <color=#df840e> -50%</color>. Construction actions required <color=#df840e> -50%</color>.
Builders learnin to recycle materials. The raw materials of demolished structures can be fully recycled.
Builders master improved techniques. Construction actions required <color=#df840e> -75%</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Furniture Factory and the Luxury Furniture Factory</color>. Unlock <color=#df840e>Furniture and Luxury Furniture</color> upgrade option for the houses.
Unlock the Mine, which produces <color=#df840e>coal</color> and <color=#df840e>Iron</color>.
New technology acquired. Now you can now build a <color=#df840e>Mine Pit</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Butcher's</color> and Veg Processing Plant.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Smelter</color> which produces Steel. Unlock the <color=#df840e>Advanced Smithy</color> .
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Senior Mine</color> and the <color=#df840e>Open Mine</color>. The possibility of <color=#df840e>accidental deaths</color> of miners <color=#df840e>decreases</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Deep Mine</color> and <color=#df840e>Open Deep Mine</color>, which can be <color=#df840e>mined with no limits</color>.
Citizens have fireplaces at home. Heating effect of all fuels <color=#df840e>+50%</color>.
Miners have upgraded their technology. Now the mines and open mines produce <color=#df840e>silver</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Mint</color> which smelters silver into convenient silver coins.
You can cure the Meat Chop and Pork into <color=#df840e>salted meat</color>, <color=#df840e>bacon</color>, and <color=#df840e>sausages</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Gold Miner's Cabin</color> which produces Gold Sand out of Sand.
Unlock <color=#df840e>Terraform</color>. You can transform mountains or rivers into flat ground. There might be risks involved. Use with caution.
Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>porcelain</color> at the pottery workshop.
Unlock the recipe for making <color=#df840e>Silver Cutlery</color> at the pottery workshop.
Unlock <color=#df840e>ceramics</color> and <color=#df840e>Silver Cutlery</color> production at the pottery workshop
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Masonry Workshop</color> and the <color=#df840e>Cut Stone Road</color>, The Cut Stone road increases walking speed by <color=#df840e>75%</color>.
Unlocking the <color=#df840e>Senior Quarry</color> and the <color=#df840e>Mountain Quarry</color> where can <color=#df840e>reduce accidental deaths</color> of Quarrymen.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Deep Quarry</color> and <color=#df840e>Deep Mountain Quarry</color>, which can be <color=#df840e>mined without limits</color>.
Number of students that the school can accommodate <color=#df840e>+5</color>, School technology points output <color=#df840e>+100%</color>.
Expand school. School capacity of students <color=#df840e>+5</color>. School technology points output <color=#df840e>+100%</color>.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Adult School</color>. Uneducated laborers can go to school. <color=#df840e>Immigrants</color> will go to school before going to work.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Research Institute</color>, which rapidly generates Tech EXP.
The school can use <color=#df840e>paper</color> to increase education efficiency <color=#df840e>by 100%</color>.
The school can use <color=#df840e>paper</color> to increase education efficiency <color=#df840e>by 100%</color>.
Fancy Food makes the citizens feel energetic and increases their maximum stamina by <color=#df840e>100%</color>. \nUnlock any technology in the third or fourth column to start research.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Boarding School</color>. School-age children will study at school until they can work.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Academy</color> and instantly obtain <color=#df840e>3</color> Development Points.
Unlock the <color=#df840e>Printing Factory</color> and the <color=#df840e>Research Academy</color>.
Practice makes perfect. Proficiency growth rate <color=#df840e>+25%</color>.
You can research <color=#df840e>any technology</color> without prerequisites.
Breakthroughs increase technology research speed by <color=#df840e>10%</color>. You can research <color=#df840e>any technology</color> without prerequisites.
This Technology may need materials unlock by tech <color=#df840e>'{1} - {0}'</color>.
A merchant ship is dispatched. You can trade with it upon its arrival at the Dock.
You can accept immigrants as citizens in the Town Hall when they arrive here to increase the population. But plague may also be brought.
{0} immigrants have arrived. Do you want to accept them as citizens?
There are no visiting immigrants at the moment. You can see if there are nomad icon on the time line at top right corner.
A ship is occupying river course
Total number of silver coins in town
Trading can only be performed when the value of the goods offered is not less than the value of the merchant's goods.
Need to choose Merchant's goods at the same price
Can pave stone roads in large areas
Can pave Cut Stone roads in large areas

Can pave jade roads in large areas
collect all resources in the selected area
