Collect all plants in the selected area
Collect all Herbs in the selected area
Prioritize tasks in the selected area
Cancel tasks in the selected area
Alter the terrain. Transform mountains or rivers into flat ground (<color=#df840e>Use with caution</color>)
Demolish roads in the selected area
Rebuild damaged buildings in the selected area.
Transform land into water (<color=#df840e>Use with caution</color>)
The town is developing well. Shall we go to the Town Hall to see if they'll take us in?
There is no Town Hall to register at. Let's go somewhere else!

The islanders have already built their home, are preparing to build the stone sculptures. However, their health is in potential risk for the shortage of Herbs, and their food and water can only last around 2 years. Help them to finish the sculptures!
Stone floor that can build under buildings
Cut Stone floor that can build under buildings
Brick floor that can build under buildings
Gold floor that can build under buildings
Jade floor that can build under buildings
Demo Population limit: 100 Tech level limit: Lv10 Map size limit: small Difficulty limit: Easy
If conflicts are caused after activating multiple mods, you will have to solve them before the mods can be loaded.
There are other items in the inventory. Please make space first.
Selling price is higher than purchase price. Proceed to trade?

A quaint old box made of seemingly quality materials has drifted over here down the river. No one knows if the box contains opportunity or danger. The settlement needs your wisdom to make a decision. Send someone down to salvage it?

A traveling merchant has come to the settlement, slowly pushing his cart as he wanders around. If you pay him some silver coins, he will offer you some goods that you have never seen before, but of unknown value. Do you want to spend silver coins to trade for his goods?
Pay a generous amount of silver coins. (Need: {0})

A wild brown bear not far from the town appeared and is destroying the trees around it, scaring away the near-by wild animals. It seems that it has lost its way and is in a panic. Do you want to calm it down and take it home, or send other citizens to capture it?
Calm it and send it home.

This area of land is unusually fertile, and perhaps that is why an unusual tree has grown on this spot. It seems that the surrounding trees are affected by its growth. Will you cut down the unusual tree, or transplant it to another spot?
<color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
Cannot place orders during a drought.
An outfit with a pumpkin head. Craftable at the <color=#df840e>Tailor</color> using <color=#df840e>pumpkins</color> and <color=#df840e>flax</color>. Keeps a citizen warm.
<color=#df840e>Decorative</color> structure that can be placed in the town.
Unlocked Tech through the administrator skill: {0}
An enormous Jack-o-Lantern. A festival can be held once every <color=#df840e>5 years</color> to gather all citizens and reduce their <color=#df840e>Stress</color>, giving Pumpkin treats.
Build a Perfect Stone Statue on Easter Island.
Build a Blemished Stone Statue on Easter Island.
A place for sterile senior citizens. Capable to accommodate 36 people. Low fuel comsumption but need to be built near Marketplace. Unlock in Tech - Livability - Senior Housing.

Can accommodate <color=#e5763f>36 people</color>. Must be built near <color=#e5763f>Marketplace</color>. Able to store enough supplies and fuel to provide basic living for the residents. <color=#e5763f>Senior citizens who are incapable of having children</color> in town will voluntarily move in.
Confirm to turn off the Guides?
Living conditions have been upgraded. Unlocked the <color=#df840e>Senior Housing</color>.

Can store items. Structure with a highlighted area. Smaller floor area. Collects designated items from all warehouses. Delivers essential raw materials to production buildings in the highlighted area. Unlocked in 'Technology - Logistics - Delivery Center'.

A <color=#df840e>crime</color> has occurred in the settlement. You can use the <color=#df840e>Sheriff's Office</color> to find them, and use the Expel button in the upper right corner of the character details to expel them.

Crimes occurring are a sign of <color=#df840e>extremely low happiness</color>. Crime can only be eliminated by increasing citizens' happiness. <color=#df840e>Churches</color>, <color=#df840e>Alcohol</color>, and <color=#df840e>Candies</color> can also increase citizens' happiness.

<color=#df840e>Tornadoes</color> and <color=#df840e>Sandstorms</color> are terrible disasters. They will destroy buildings along their way, sweep away supplies, causing the death of citizens, plants and animals.

<color=#df840e>Shelters</color> can protect citizens' lives when these disasters hit, and the <color=#df840e>Reinforcement</color> remodel can keep buildings from being destroyed. Besides, <color=#df840e>wild trees</color> can weaken and stop the momentum of <color=#df840e>Sandstorm</color>.

<color=#df840e>Herbs</color> in stock are running low. Citizens' health will be hard to maintain without them. <color=#df840e>Herbs</color> can be gathered in the wild and its seeds can be obtained through gathering after unlocking the technology or through trading in order to stabilize your supply.
Also, <color=#df840e>Soaps</color> can also be used to increase health. It can be used as an alternative of Herbs or Medicine.
<color=#df840e> Silver coins </color> are necessary if you want to order goods from overseas. <color=#df840e> Trading Post</color> can be built to sell goods to get silver coins.
Even if you don't have silver coins, you can still <color=#df840e>trade for goods</color> with a docked merchant ship.
There is a lack of <color=#df840e>Builders</color> in the settlement. Building construction and demolition will both <color=#df840e>be halted</color>.
Build a Builders' Cabin in <color=#df840e>Services(6)</color>, or click on an existing <color=#df840e> Builders' Cabin </color> to add a Builder.
A Citizen is caught the <color=#df840e>plague</color>. This disease is highly infectious, and requires the development of the necessary Tech in order to treat effectively.
The Soap, Hospital, Bathhouse and Pharmacy in <color=#df840e>Livability Tech</color> can treat the infectious disease effectively.
<color=#df840e> Without enough Tech Points </color>, you cannot develop new Tech. <color=#df840e> Education </color> type buildings can produce Tech EXP.
<color=#df840e> Research Institutes </color> can produce a large amount of Tech EXP. Upgrading it to Research Academy, spending Papers and Books, are all good ways to produce Tech Points.
Ban citizens from using or eating the item. Item can only be processed.
Selection limit has been reached, unable to select!

It is said that there was a gurgling sound and even a muffled voice in the well even no one was fetching water from it. Citizens who live near this well are starting to feel scared. Do you go investigate the well?
Event - Voices From the Well (click to trigger)
Water fetchers were carefully checking the well when a translucent ghost suddenly emerged! The ghost took out come candies, seemingly inviting the citizens to eat some together.
The story of the well haunted by a ghost spread, causing water fetchers to be too afraid to work. Some citizens couldn't sleep well, and even children who hears the story refuses to drink water.

For several months in a row, when the market vendors are taking stock, they had found that certain small items constantly go missing, and their records just couldn't match up. They finally decided to investigate the entire market, but where should they start their investigation?
The enclosed staircase partition was filled with a jumble of miscellaneous items.
The hollow plank wall contained a squirrel nest, and a large amount of supplies.
The squirrel ran away with a squeak.
Looking at the poor little squirrel, the citizens did not take anything, and put the plank wall back.
Event - Bee Swarm Crisis (click to trigger)

Spring wildflowers are blooming beautifully. Some citizens want to pick some flowers to decorate their homes, but soon discovered that this year's honey hives are extraordinarily numerous. There are so many bee hives in the woods near the settlement. Do you want to clean up these hives?
Citizens smoked away the bees with smoke.
Because there were so many swarms of bees in the woods, some citizens were stung when they went out.
Event - Beautiful View of Old Trees (click to trigger)

The old trees in the settlement blooms pink every spring, and the beauty of their falling petals attracts more and more outsiders to come and visit. Several glamorously-dressed tourists are now interested to settle here after seeing the settlement developing so well. Will you welcome them?
The tourists felt very sorry and left after buying the flower petal accessory made by the villagers as a souvenir.
Event - Waves of Lobsters (click to trigger)

Seafood these years are more abundant than usual, which seems it's the years when an extraordinary number of lobsters will breed. Do you think we should take this opportunity to fish more? Though overfishing might have an impact on next year's production.
Fishermen in Fishing Port harvested a large number of lobsters.
Next year's output from Fishing Ports is sure to grow by a lot.

A young lumberjack was tending to the trees around the lumberyard as usual, when he found several crooked trees that were not suitable for further processing to become wood. But perhaps they could be used as decorative trees if transplanted. Do you want to cut them down?
Dig them out and transplant them as decorative trees.
After a spring rain, the sky cleared and a beautiful rainbow appeared. The temperature has warmed up a lot under the sunshine. Perhaps we can pray that this year will be a warm year.
The sunlight coming in from among the leaves seemed warmer.
A breeze blew. The spring breeze at this time is still quite chilly.
Event - Industry or Agriculture (click to trigger)

Many workers have found that they can increase work efficiency and production by increasing power and water consumption at the expense of producing more wastewater containing pollutants. Grant them a permit?
Self-purification capacity of water is surpassed as more wastewater has been discharged for the increased production output. This pollution has led to a decline in fishery production.
Event - Stolen Salted Fish (click to trigger)

Recently the workers at the Curing Workshop noticed that several pieces of meat drying in the sun will go missing every day. They suspected that some naughty kids had taken them, but could never catch the culprit in action. Should we further look into this case?
Assign citizens to guard the place.
The man on duty waited until midnight, only to find the culprit was a group of kittens!
Salted fish kept being stolen, and no one was able to find the culprit.
Event - Deep Into the Mine (click to trigger)

A miner found some pieces of rare ores at a corner while working in mine. The mine structure there seemed unsafe, but if you dig deeper, you might be able to mine out more of rare ores. Do you want to risk mining these ores?
A collapse occurred during mining, killing some miners. Only a small amount of silver ore had been obtained.
The miners took the risk and opened up a new mine area. The production of ores will increase a lot in the next few years.
Event - The Prom in Great Castle (click to trigger)

After the Great Castle was completed, citizens have begin to lead a more comfortable life inside their bigger living space. Everyone started to regularly hold small parties in the castle hall, and someone even proposed to hold a large ball here.
The citizens held an extravagant ball at the Great Castle.
The citizens were frustrated that the ball was canceled, but soon discovered that by doing so, they were fortunate enough to avoid a widespread epidemic.

The heat is unbearable. Some citizens are resting by the riverside as they cool off, but there are also some people propose to go for a swim in the river. The river looks calm, and many citizens are tempted to go for a swim. Do you want to stop them?
Citizens who gave up swimming continued to cool off under the trees and accidentally picked up wild mushrooms.
The river was far more dangerous than it appeared to be, and multiple swimmers drowned.
The days are getting hotter, and some citizens suffered heatstroke at work.
The citizens were able to cool off the heat in the water, and even caught many lobsters.

The fog is particularly thick in late autumn, and for several days in a row citizens have collided with their neighbors in the thick early morning fog, and accidentally spilled the goods they were carrying to the ground. Perhaps they should slow down to ensure safety during this time.
Tell the citizens to walk carefully.
Movement speed was lowered in the fog, but safety was preserved.
A citizen sprained his ankle while going out in the fog!

The days are freezing, and fuel is running out. If there is no way to heat the houses, people may freeze to death inside. Thus, some citizens have considered bringing out old furniture and burning it to heat their home.
Citizens used some of the old furniture as domestic fuel, but they didn't last long.

Miners in the settlement feel that the current explosives used for mining are not powerful enough to substantially improve mining efficiency. Thus, they want to develop new explosives, but they couldn't figure out how much saltpeter should be used in the formula.
A small explosion occurred during the blending, but fortunately no one was hurt.
The explosives worked well, and mining efficiency had improved.
Event - A Strange Patient (click to trigger)

The hospital admitted a patient who was unable to move his limbs. The patient had been in a coma with a high fever for a week, but did not seem to have a life-threatening condition. Doctors had been studying this case for a long time and were at a loss, having never seen this disease before.
Take risks with drugs that may be effective.
Use conservative treatment to maintain the patient's stability.
The patient soon regained consciousness, but his body mysteriously shrank a lot, and he moved with newfound agility.
A few days later, the patient's body mysteriously swelled a lot, but he regained his health, and seemed to be in better health now.

In recent days, one particular citizen seems to be sleepwalking. No matter how much others call out to him, there is no response, and he continues on without eating or drinking. People around here are really worried. Force him to wake up?
This citizen awoke from his sleep. 'It seems that I have a long dream, where I was alone in a desert and couldn't get out no matter how I tried, and now I feel so hungry and thirsty.'

The citizen awoke from his sleep after two days. 'It seems that I have a long dream, where I was alone in a desert and couldn't get out there no matter how I tried. I feel so hungry and thirsty at first, but now I am totally fine, not hungry or thirsty at all.'
Event - The Mysterious Merchant (click to trigger)
A mysterious merchant, dressed like a foreigner, came to the settlement and hawked his goods to citizens passing by. '200*Croissant only for 1000 silver coins! Get this deal before it's too late!'

The merchant sold the food and left, after which people started suffering from bad stomachaches one after another. It turned out that he is a crooked merchant who is selling rotten ingredients at low prices.
Event - Beware of Wild Mushrooms (click to trigger)

Since autumn began, never-before-seen mushrooms have been found by gatherers to be sprouting in the wild. It does not look like a poisonous species, but whether or not it is edible is anyone's guess. Do you want to try it?
The mushrooms were poisonous, and citizens who tried them nearly died.

Harvest season is coming. Fruits in the wild ripened, and sturdy weeds by the river can also be collected. Some citizens intend to go out to search for some of these supplies in the wild. Where should they head to?
There were many ripe wild fruits in the shrubs and they came back with a good harvest.
The weeds along the river were tall and tough, and the citizens cut some and tied them into Scarecrows.
A stranger with a large piece of luggage and thin clothing was freezing in the snow, and was hoping to warm up in the town. The citizens helped him into the house to shelter from the wind and snow.
Ask him where he came from.
He turned out to be a lost merchant, and he presented some goods he was carrying to the citizens to show his appreciation.
It turned out that the merchant's ship was shipwrecked upstream. He could only bring a small amount of goods with him, and he gifted a few of the goods to the citizens as a thank-you gift.
Event - Whimpers In the Grass (click to trigger)

It's winter time, and animals and plants out in the wild are now much more scarce. But some citizens who was out reported that there are some soft whimpering coming from the grass field. Could it be some kind of animal?
A litter of kittens are shivering in the grass.
Something scurried out and disappeared into the snow.
Event - Something took the bait? (click to trigger)

A seasoned fisherman found something took the bait while fishing, but strangely it was not struggling like a fish. It only appears to be something very heavy that's hooked, and it took some mad effort to drag it up.
Event - Beware of Wild Mushrooms (click to trigger)

Since Autumn began, never-before-seen mushrooms have been found by gatherers to be sprouting in the wild. It does not look like a poisonous species, but whether or not it is edible is anyone's guess. Do you want to try it?
This type of mushroom tastes really bad, but it can still be used as food.
A light spark glided through the clear night sky, it’s a shooting star! It is said that if you make a wish to a shooting star, your wish will come true. What do you wish for?
The shooting star disappeared into the night sky. Whether or not it will bring good fortune is anyone's guess.
The shooting star disappeared into the night sky. Whether or not it will bring good fortune is anyone's guess.

Although drinking can improve one's mood, too much drinking just leads to drunkenness. Last night, a citizen drank too much and fell into the river. Fortunately he was not injured, but he woke up, he suddenly found a bag of silver coins scattered around next to him.
Pick it up and take away.
They investigated along the river, and discovered a bunch of goods floating, some of which had been damaged.
Pick up only the ones that can be used.

A citizen who kept a cat as a pet were shocked to find a fresh dead mouse at the door when they went out in the morning. The cat was innocently sleeping next to it. It seems to be a gift from the cat, but should it be accepted?
It's too scary! Throw it away quickly!
Although you accept it, perhaps it's better to grill it before eating it.
Event - The Mysterious Merchant (click to trigger)
A mysterious merchant, dressed like a foreigner, came to the settlement and hawked his goods to the citizens. 'Hear ye, hear ye! 3000 silver coins for 200 special medicine! Buy them or miss them!'
Then how about this? 150*fruit candy, only for 500 silver coins.'
Event - A New Recipe (click to trigger)

The beverage store only has a small variety of drinks. To develop new products in order to bring in business opportunities, an employee proposes to mix and blend different flavors of drinks to create new trial drinks. What kind of new ingredient should be used?
The new recipe was successful, and cocoa with milk became a very popular drink among the citizens.
The coffee with fruit was loved by passing merchant caravans, and was bought in large quantities.
The fishermen strove hard to salvage the box. Some raw materials have been obtained, but the risk of accidents for fishermen was also increased.
The drift box has floated away, and there is no longer any chance to salvage it.
After smoothly trading with the traveling merchant, some exquisite food were obtained. The merchant left with great satisfaction.
The traveling merchant didn’t manage to sell anything, and left the town brokenhearted.
Surprisingly, two groups of Idle Chickens were found beside the bear.
Some citizens were sent to capture the bear, and a large amount of animal fat were obtained. However, due to the bear's struggle, some citizens ended up as sacrifices.
A significant amount of wood was obtained after this tree was chopped down, but because the ecosystem was also damaged, it has caused the trees in the settlement to grow slower.
Since this tree was transplanted to another location, the fertile soil was preserved. Seems like the trees in the settlement are growing more rapidly.
Floods will inundate farmland and cause no harvest.
The flood broke out, the farmland was submerged, and the crops died.

Floods can inundate farmland and cause large-scale crop deaths. Manually harvesting crops in advance before flooding can sometimes recover some of the losses. Reserving enought food for emergencies can avoid famine even without harverst from cropland due to disasters.
Obtain through trade or Gathering after unlocking skill Herb Knowledge.
Remodel a tent with campfire, making the citizens live happily and increase their happiness.
Keeping a puppy in house can lower citizens' stress.
A gigantic alpaca has run into your city! It seems to be in shock and was running around, injuring several people. How are you going to deal with it?
The alpaca fiercely resisted and ran away after injuring several people.
The panicked alpaca ran around the city and died after hitting the fence.
As sowing season is arriving, farmers start to plow the farmland. They get some stone and weed from there. It seems these materials are recyclable, so how are you going to deal with them?

As temperature rises, the number of mosquitoes also increases which makes citizens often bitten and infected with infectious diseases. They are not fatal, but they surely affect citizens' work efficiency.
After citizens cleaned up the town thoroughly, mosquitoes were much less and their health was guaranteed.
A bunch of drunkards were lighting the campfire and holding a party near the city. Unexpectedly, they started to argue about which wine was better, and asked others and you to judge.
Some disapproved of this answer and brought out loads of Whiskey for them to appreciate.
Some disapproved of this answer and brought out loads of Medicinal Liquor for others to appreciate.
Over two dozen peasants were wandering in your town, looking for a new place to settle in. The soil of their former settlement was poor and yielded few crops.
The peasants accepted your invitation and settled in your town with the seeds they used to plant in their ex-settlement.
There is smoke rising from the forest, and soon people can confirm that is a fire. Since it is not big yet, should we put out the fire first or cut down surrounding trees to stop fire to spread?
Citizens successfully put out the fire and picked up a lot of twigs for winter.
Citizens successfully stopped the fire from spreading, and also caught some animals trying to escape from the fire.
Event - Happy New Year(click to trigger)
As the year comes to a close, citizens are checking their inventory, wondering what supplies they should prepare for celebrating the new year.
A Hole in the Snow (click to trigger)
The ground was covered by a seamless white coating after a heavy snow, but a citizen still found a hole there has been dug up, with dirt and snow scattered around.
Citizens dug up a lot of good clay, but found no treasure.
A few days later, a huge wild boar appeared nearby, and the citizens worked together to kill the wild boar.
Event - A Gift from a Gourmet (click to trigger)
A chubby gourmet was passing through town, having a good talk with the citizens who treated him. He wanted to treat them back with his food but he wondered which ingredients do citizens prefer?

Hunters always need to go out for hunting, and sometimes they have to go somewhere faraway because they can't find any trace of animals nearby. So a hunter wants to make food that is easy to take with.
Suggest him to take some longlasting food.

There is a mysterious building outside the town. It does not belong to your town but occupies the land here, and other buildings cannot be built here. Should we demolish the building or wait for it to leave?
Just as citizens were about to go up and demolish the building, it flew away, leaving bewildered citizens and a burst of fire behind.
It wasn't long before the building disappeared of its own accord, and the only evidence of its existence was a pile of building materials he left behind.

An unidentified flying object suddenly showed up in your town, hovering over your place and sending out mysterious waves. It seemed like saying hello to you. Will you respond or pretend not seeing it?
They friendly greet you and teach you their planting technology. After they flew away, the yields from farm seems to have a increase!
They seem to be mad at you for not getting a response, and they've taken a few of your citizens to do experiments, but they've also left behind a bunch of mysterious items.
A giant Christmas tree, which will send gifts to kids <color=#df840e>every 5 years</color>.
A lovely snowman built on streets can increase the health of citizens in the area. Can be built on roads.
<color=#df840e>Decorative</color> trees that can be placed in the town. Require decorative saplings.
Decorate houses with Christmas trees to make the house full of festive atmosphere and improve the happiness of citizens.

The earthquake caused by the movement of the earth's crust will create extra mountains on the map, which will destroy the houses with low durability. The old houses need to be repaired before the earthquake to avoid being destroyed, and the wild animals on the map will escape, and there will be no wild animals for a period of time.
The earthquake is coming. Wild animals are killed and low durability buildings are destroyed.
An earthquake will kill all wildlife on the map, and low durability buildings will be destroyed.

Animal plague causes the gradual death of animals on a Pasture, so it is necessary to keep the animals in pens for breeding before the plague arrives and to slaughter them as soon as possible to avoid greater loss.
Animal plague is coming. It will break out in Pasture, causing death of Pasture Animals.
Animal plague will gradually spread to and kill animals in the same Pasture.

Sandstorm is extremely destructive and will destroy all plants, buildings and citizens as it passes by. However, the scale of sandstorm will reduce after passing trees, so more trees are needed to eliminate a sandstorm.
Sandstorm is coming. All buildings and trees in its path will be distroyed. Animals and people will be taken away. Trees can reduce its scale.
The sandstorm will destroy all buildings and trees in its path and take away animals and people.

Christmas Hat, clothing, made from <color=#df840e>Cotton</color> or <color=#df840e>Linen</color> and <color=#df840e>Wool</color> or <color=#df840e>Alpaca Wool</color> in <color=#df840e>Tailor</color>.
Animal in this structure is suffering from Plague.
{0} ({1}) is missing due to sandstorm and there is no tombstone for people to mourn over.
{0} ({1}) has been taken away by sandstorm.

In this ‘Banished’ inspired city-builder, lead a group of survivors in their search for a new home. Manipulate the landscape, manage limited supplies, plant crops, hunt wildlife, gather resources, and develop trade routes to build a bustling and unique town. 'During this Early Access stage, we hope players will become an integral part of the development process, providing feedback and suggestions to grow the feature set and improve the experience. Early Access is expected to last for a minimum of six months and we welcome you all to discuss and communicate here during that time. Our team will be keeping a close eye on the Steam discussions and reviews, listening to each player’s feedback and opinions to improve the gameplay accordingly, while simultaneously optimizing for performance and stability.'
'The Early Access is expected to last at least six months. During this period, we will continue to update the contents of follow-up plan.'
'Our roadmap for the game includes, but is not limited to: Exploration Mode: Updated levels, more historical stories, and new difficulty challenges. Civic Center and Tourism: Develop tourism, boost tourist consumption, and attract new talent to your city. Blueprints: Further blueprints for structures and effects will enrich the gaming experience by providing additional methods of development and routes to success. Player Workshop: MOD editing tools will be available. Multiplayer (Possible): Online mode where multiple players can interact and develop on the same map. Transportation and Logistics (Possible): More complex logistics and transportation lines, allowing you to manage the industrial routes as you choose. Multi-language: English version. '
'Our current build provides all the core features of the game, including: Full experience in random map mode. Functionality and industrial routes for more than 100 constructions. Early warning and response to disasters capability. Trade - focused gameplay. 108 development skills that unlock buildings and abilities. Proficiency mechanics for eight different play - styles. For further information, please refer to the 'About the Game' section below.'
'Thank you for your support, we may adjust the price after the Early Access period.'
'Our developers will keep an eye on Steam’s community and reviews in which we will post future updates and changes. You are invited to discuss and communicate here with us, and we'll be sure to listen to each player’s feedback and comments.' ABOUT THIS GAME Lead your people to their new settlement in this survival city - builder. You will need to provide their shelter, guarantee the food supply, protect against threats of nature, and pay attention to well - being, happiness, education, and employment. Do all of this well, and you might even attract residents from foreign cities! Choose where to build your settlement based on nearby resources, before determining your perfect layout. How will you build your settlement? Carve out the land, join rivers, form lakes and use your tools to shape your settlement exactly how you want it. Build housing, recruit Mayors to determine the morality of your settlement, control crime and ensure your baby - booms don’t negatively impact your resources. Experience all seasons and heed the early warning signs of disasters. Bunker down and protect your citizens from the elements as well as envIronmental disasters, or risk losing all that you’ve built. Offering powerful effects, unique themes and styles, rare blueprints are an opportunity to customize your settlement even further when you’ve mastered the art of trading. Determine which development routes you will choose, with options that range from trading, education, mining, construction, agriculture, processing, logistics, and liveability. Each route unlocks new buildings and abilities to boost development. and there is no set pattern to the route selection, so you can choose freely and play to your staminas. With each map randomly generated, right down to its resources and landmarks, every experience is unique and brings with it its own challenges. Whether exchanging artistic items of high value, unprocessed products or unlocking the mint to create a common currency, trade is key to your populations survival. Experience a unique game mode designed to challenge even the most experienced player. From the bubonic plague in Europe, to the Easter Island disaster, are you able to overcome its challenges?
Event - the Arrival of a Sommelier (click to trigger)
A self-proclaimed master sommelier came to your town and disbelieved people in the town could produce fine wine. 'You must be talking big. I dare you to show me the wine in your warehouse?'
Show the premium wine in warehouse. (Need {0} in stock)
Didn't expect there are people here who appreciate fine wine!' The sommelier was deeply touched and gifted his whiskey collection to you.
Lack of wine in stock, you missed the opportunity to impress the sommelier.
Event - The Joining of Scholars (click to trigger)

Around twenty or so young scholars passed through the town. 'Based on our measurements of paper use in this town, you have a strong desire to spread knowledge. We would like to join this academic place.'
The town's clothing industry is booming, and our officials want to invite famous designers to hold a fashion show here. However, the designers have one requirement:
We'd love to hold a fashion show if there are {0} stocked in your town.
The designers were impressed by the citizens' exquisite clothing, and so they shared a batch of their well-designed gowns.
As time went on, some citizens wanted to emigrate to other cities, and some immigrants wanted to go back to their former homeland. They left the town but may come back to visit in the future!

We are starving! Could you offer us some food?' There were more than 20 refugees from famine areas trying to get relief here. If we had enough food, maybe we could help them. Otherwise, our citizens may have to compete with refugees for food.

Some artisans from other places passed through the town and wanted to engage in collaborative learning with the locals. 'Everything here is so beautifully made! Your craftsmanship is very advanced! Can you show me your tools?'
Hone their skills by collaborative learning. (Need: {0} in stock)
Through collaborative learning, the local artisans acquired more practical tool usage techniques. The output in all kinds of workshops will increase by 20% in the next year.
Event - Foodie's Adventure Team (click to trigger)
A gourmet named Foodie came to the town with his adventure team. You wonder what food in town can appeal to them?
Invite them to taste the local cuisine. (require {0} in stock)
The local cuisine impressed them, who then shared many recipes with the citizens.
More people in the caravan lowers the risk of death but will prolong the trade time.
Pay {0} coins to buy insurance for the caravan. {1} coins will be compensated if your caravan meet with a mishap.

With money inside as protective talisman, red packet is what parents in traditional eastern cultures will give to their kids to suppress evil spirits and keep them safe throughout the year.

Citizens put up the Chinese character 'Fu' and prepared a lot of food to celebrate the Lunar New Year.
The character 'Fu' is pasted upside down, that is, 'happiness is flowing down into you' in the New Year!

The explosion of firecrackers and the red paper seemed to startle the monster. It quickly ran away.

Try to solve the lantern riddles.

Wow! It's a red packet for Lunar New Year.

Strong winds and heavy rains from the ocean this year was far beyond normal levels, and sudden floods displaced my people. Now the disaster is over, but we are in need of wood to rebuild our homes.

Agriculture is our top priority, but this year the locust plague happened. The locusts that spread all over the ground are eating the farmers' crops! In order that our people may not suffer from famine... We need help.

After years of disaster, we finally started to make our city booming! Now our people are working hard for a better life. However, there is a slight shortage of building materials for our rapidly growing cities. Could you support me with some building materials?

The magnificent and lofty city buildings are the symbol of our strength! It's time to think about something stronger and more beautiful including our town hall. We have heard that the building materials from your place are of good quality, so we want to purchase a large quantity, could you give us a discount?

Some collectors here are so fond of exotic products that they are willing to exchange large amounts of valuable goods for those special items. I wonder if you have them in stock? I can introduce you those who want to buy them.

Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'In the small towns near the water, we saw a great number of Silkworm Sheds and Textile Mills, where the finest silk anywhere could be produced. We consulted on weaving skills and were given a gift of silk.'

Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'Our captain has learned the language of the other country, and this time he bargained very smoothly in selling items, which allowed us to get a lot of extra income.'

Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'We caught up with all the meetings of foreign merchants, where a lot of them saw our products for the first time. Without question, they loved it, and the word of our town had spread. It's gonna be so much easier to set up a stall.'
Distinguished guest! Seeing how well your town is doing, I'd like to introduce you to our fancy casino. Maybe you'll get to know more people with your swagger.

It's always freezing cold in the area on north of the sea, but this winter has been even more challenging than usual. To add insult to injury, we have a problem with our fuel supply, and now we are in need of more fuel for living...
The plague has just stopped and we have lots of fields and farms but not enough labor, so there will be famine again this year...Would anyone like to live here?I'll make sure you're treated right.

The permission for immigration came just in time. We had some people who wanted to move here because of the plague there. And I heard you guys have great medical care. Would you please help these poor people?

Have you ever thought why our Beef exports are expensive? That's because our cattle are well kept. There are dedicated entertainment area in our cowsheds, and we would hold an afternoon tea party once a week for them! We could have a talk if you want to learn from us.

Bandaged members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'On the way we met a fighting among local factions, and several men were injured and part of the cargo was lost. Fortunately, we were not the only ones who lost money. There was a shortage of all kinds of goods in the market, and the goods remained were sold at higher prices.'

Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'We happened to run into someone who had overproduction in their ranch this year, and a lot of ranch products were on sale, so we brought some back.'

Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'Local fishermen invited us to go sailing and experience the life at sea. To be honest, we puked all the way through. However, there still was a small gain.'

I'm Carlos. We live in a place where the soil is so poor that we can't support too many people. Even the souls that God can take in are limited. Can you take in these old people who have nowhere to go?

What? Haven't you heard of our Almighty God? Let me tell you a good story about them... Hey, why didn't you listen? Our sacrificial festival is coming again. Our god not only likes human sacrifice, but also exquisite pottery, but good pottery is not so easy to make...

Guess what, when I woke up this morning, there was another group of old men and women outside my house. They were kicked out by their kids! Still weeping there! And told me they haven't eaten yet! How can I feed so many people? By the way, has your Senior Housing been built yet? Can I sign up for them?

I saw that many rich people in other countries are carrying the handbags made by you, how fashionable! Could you give me some to let the young people in our small town also wear some fashionable trinkets? !

We were getting more and more people here, and there was not enough food to eat. My friend, I heard there are many places in your town willing to take young people, and, of course, many of our young people want to move out. I promise, they are the best workforce!

Members of the caravan told of their wonderful experience: 'This business trip was really thrilling, we lost our way in the tropical rainforest and were almost eaten by crocodiles. There were snakes everywhere, and big bugs. Luckily, we met some locals and they gave us plenty of food to eat.'

The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'The locals really like offering sacrifices! And during the sacrifice, we outsiders are not allowed to enter the village, and business will be delayed. At this moment, there was a sacrificial event. We had nothing to do outside the village and collected a lot of agave from the wild. '

The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'The locals, already familiar with our caravan, were finally willing to let us participate in the festival and were blessed. Not kidding, their gods are really efficacious, and we all felt much luckier during the journey, and all the problems were saved. '

Hi. I am Rania. Nice to see your caravan here. Our country's biggest problem has always been water scarcity. Can you provide us with water? Anyone in our land who can receive help from you would know and thank you.
Our people love to make clothing. But recently our cotton farm has been devastated by natural disasters and my favorite scarves are now less and less on the market. Can you bring some cotton here?
Our people love to make clothing. But recently our linen field has been devastated by natural disasters and my favorite scarves are now less and less on the market. Can you bring some linen here?

Hi, how are you doing? I'm visiting because we need some groceries and wonder if you can do me a favor. Next time if you happen to run out of salt for cooking at home, come ask me for some. We are the neighbors who would help each other.

Why haven't the goods been delivered after waiting for several days? It seems that something was wrong with our caravan on the road. But we're really in dire need of some Leather Shoes. The feet of the workers who work in the fields are worn out. My heart aches for them.

If you've seen our premium custom gowns, you know we're the industry leader. To thank you for your help in the past, I'd like to sell you some of the custom gowns at a discount. Please note that our luxury items don't usually drop in price.
The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We brought back many local specialties, be it food or drinks. And the wine there was really good! We were high as f*** after drinking it! '

The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We've been to the metropolis this time. There were goods from all over the world. We brought back some specialties from other places this time. '

The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'Traveling in the desert is unforgettable. I always imagined that monsters would crawl out of the sand and guard the underground treasures. But guess what, we actually found the source of a rare ore on the way! '
I heard that your town has trade relations with Miao's. We are in urgent need of a batch of bamboo and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Lorenzo's. We are in urgent need of a batch of hardwood and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Carlos'. We are in urgent need of a batch of dates and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Rania's. We are in urgent need of a batch of cactus and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Miao's. We are in urgent need of a batch of bamboo baskets and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Lorenzo's. We are in urgent need of a batch of hardwood tools and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Carlos'. We are in urgent need of a batch of dyeing cloth and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Rania's. We are in urgent need of a batch of obsidian tools and are willing to purchase it at a much higher than market price.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Miao's. We are in urgent need of lots of tofu. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Lorenzo's. We are in urgent need of lots of oysters. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Carlos's. We are in urgent need of lots of exquisite swords. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.
I heard that your town has trade relations with Rania's. We are in urgent need of lots of tacos. You got them in stock? I promise you would satisfy with the price we offer.

The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'When we were looking for a buyer for the goods, a seemingly enthusiastic businessman came and introduced the local customs and culture, but the price he offered was outrageously low. Fortunately, he did not know our goods well, so we vaunt and hype our goods and ripped him off. '

The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We heard a cry for help when walking on the steep mountain road. After searches, we found it was a local with injured legs. So we took him home, where we were warmly entertained, and before leaving he gave him some silver coins as a thank you. '
The caravan members recounted their wonderful experience: 'We found a lot of abandoned materials in the wilderness, and some of the building materials were still available, so we brought them back. '

A man in ragged clothes came to the town. The villagers stepped forward to ask and found that he was actually a member of the caravan in distress. After many twists and turns in other places, he finally returned here.

A well-dressed old man came to the town, claiming that he had been a citizen here many years ago, but was shipwrecked while following a caravan out to trade, and in order to make a living in the field with the remaining supplies in his hands to start a business, and is now quite wealthy. Now he wants to return to the place where he used to live, but no one knows him anymore, to take him in?
Oops, is there a caravan in distress? It's a shame, but just buy our insurance and you'll be able to recover some of your losses in the event of a distress!
Thank you for your trust, I will give small gifts to excellent partners.
It will be too late regretting the loss until you meet with a mishap!
I see that our insurance has saved you a major loss! See? I did not lie to you. We welcome you to continue buying! I will also give more gifts to senior customers.
I heard that {name of disaster} attacked this town, we have food and water here, please accept these supplies. I hope it can help you.
A lot of animals got sick and died? These animal husbandry products are given to you. In the future, you should pay more attention to the management of pastures!
Our God can feel the earth shaking in the distance. Accept these materials to overcome the natural disaster!
Were any homes damaged in the disaster? I wonder if these building materials can help you rebuild them.
Thanks for your support, our refugees were resettled in time. We will remember your assistance at such a critical time.
Now we can get through this winter. Thank you!
This is great! Soon people will be able to move from the shack into the house!
With such high-quality building materials, even our workers couldn't help asking about the origin.
Can't win? Take it easy! What about one more round to make it even?
This really saved me! Or else everyone here would move out because of no heating!
Take this opportunity to experience a different life!' The young people left with a dream.
Sure enough, some immigrants contracted the plague. Plague is highly contagious and has a high fatality rate. Please handle with caution.
Carlos was deeply grateful, and soon a group of thirsty and hungry old men came to town. 'We felt hopeless at one point. Thank you for hosting us. You are really a nice person. '
Fabulous! Our God is satisfied. I will say a few good words for you in the presence of God.
Thank you! Although we are old, we can still do something. Hope to spend the rest of my life here.'
A fashion craze was sweeping over our town. Whether it was a college student, a farmer, or a small factory worker, everyone wanted a small leather bag.
We no longer have to live in a shabby room with several people, and now we can have a better job and life here with more abundant materials.
The water was enough to ease our endless anxiety for a while. Thank you so much.
With these materials, our people in garment-making industry can start working again. Nobody likes the feeling of being unemployed. Not to mention, what a wonderful job that is!
It's great to have friends like you! Now I'm going to be tinkering with the house with these materials.
Thank you. Our workers will remember you being good to them!
Being able to purchase our high-end luxury brand at such a low price is something that nearly no fashionista dares to imagine!
It's really pleasant working with you.
Thank you so much, my customers will appreciate the supplies.
You are my best trading partner to be able to provide such rare materials in time!
That's a shame. Reckon I'll have to look elsewhere for this shipment.
Are you also reluctant to sell? Where can I find such rare goods? What a headache.

Tip: press and hold the building icon in the bottom menu bar to learn more details about the building.
Tip: you can turn off View Rotation in Settings.
Tip: when opening too many panels, you can double-tap the blank space outside the panel interface to close them all.
Tip: Citizen Stress and housing affect the Fertility Rate.
Tip: most structures can be remodeled to enhance their functions.
Tip: you can accept immigrants in the Town Hall.
Tip: Fishing Docks are affected by Fishing Points and water areas. When multiple Fishing Dock ranges overlap, output decreases.
Tip: roads can increase citizens' movement speed, and more advanced roads have more bonus effects.
Tip: tools have huge impacts on work efficiency, so please produce more advanced tools.
Tip: citizens who wear clothes can work outdoors longer in cold weather or gather resources far away.
Tip: when Happiness is low, food consumption increases and citizens are more likely to commit crimes.
Tip: when Health is low, work efficiency decreases, citizens become more prone to disease, and plague is more likely to erupt.

·Tap the iron pickaxe icon to find the command <color=#df840e>Fell Trees</color>. ·After tapping the command, circle the range of trees you want. ·Tree and plant resources on the map will slowly regenerate. Iron ore and rock resources are not renewable.

·Tap the palace icon at the top to enter Town Technology. ·Find the technology Marquee in Livability. Tap the icon to learn more details. ·Activate a Technology with 1 Technology Point. You will receive 1 Technology Point after leveling up.
Press and hold the building icon to learn the details.
